story:
***Note, if you are passionate about this campaign and would like to continue with the contributions, any extra proceeds collected above my request will be donated to my other classmates who were unable to reach their goals.

 

I'm an 8th grade student who wrote an essay and was selected to attend an American History field trip to Washington DC in March of 2015. I live in a financially struggling school district. This amazing trip is 3-nights/4-days (visit monuments, night-time cemetery tour, Gettysburg, and we have applied for admission to the White House). I will travel from Michigan to Washington DC by bus. The $500 will help cover the costs associated for transportation, food, and lodging for this amazing opportunity to visit the Nation's Capital.

story:
Work Options for Women is a unique Nonprofit organization in Denver that provides culinary job training, advanced skills courses, transitional employment, individualized supportive services and job placement, free of charge for those that qualify and need it most. We have recently been certified by the American Culinary Federation as an official apprenticeship-training site for sous chefs and prep cooks. Our students gain hands on experience by training in one of our three social enterprise cafes; WOW Café at Denver Human Services, Café Options in downtown Denver, and Café United in the new Morgridge Center for Community Change.

We are asking for your support to purchase necessary equipment for the Barista Training Center at our newest training site, Café United – a kitchen for social change.

  • (Used) Nuova Simonelli Appia Volumetric 1 Group Espresso Machine Mappia5vol01nd003 – Price:  $3,000
  • Nuova Simonelli Thermoelectric Milk Cooler - Price:  $789.00
  • 4 - Stainless Steel 66 oz. Frothing Pitchers - Price: $100
  • Nuova Simonelli (AMCE6021) - 3 lbs Eureka Espresso Grinder – Price: $820.00
  • 4 - 6" Long Digital Thermometer – Price: $120.00
  • 4 – Aluminum Tamper – Price: $132.00
  • 4 – 2.25 oz Espresso Shot Glass – Price: $200
Work Options for Women’s mission is to help impoverished women gain the skills and confidence they need to work their way out of poverty and become gainfully and permanently employed in the food service industry.

For more information about Work Options for Women, visit our website at: workoptions.org.



The Impact

We believe in culinary education as a pathway to self-sufficiency.

Our newest Social Enterprise, Cafe United, will open in October in the new Mile High United Way Morgridge Center for Community Change at Park Ave. and California Street in Denver, Colorado.  The new site will provide advanced training and supervisory skills with hands-on training for our graduates offering cutting-edge skills making them most competitive for advancement in the food service industry.

Thank you for your support and partnership to continue changing lives, one student at a time!  Come on in and visit us to see for yourself how good self-respect and empowerment with a twist of optimism, can taste! Delicious!

The Perks:

$10  USD - Free Barista Beverage with receipt of donation of $10 or more!

$15 USD - Face Book Shout Out!

$30 USD - Heartfelt Note of Thanks!


$50 USD - WOW Re-usable Bag!


$100 USD - The Sous Chef


$200 USD - The Barista


$1000 USD - WOW Cooking Class for 10 by Chef Jeff



Other Ways You Can Help

Help us build momentum for the campaign by:

  1. Emailing the campaign link to anyone who you think might be interested in contributing or sharing
  2. Use the social icons on our campaign homepage to share through Facebook, Twitter, and Google+
  3. Add a comment to our campaign homepage and share why you believe in this work!

Social Media Inspiration:

Facebook - Build a better future with Wow Denver (Work Options for Women) at igg.me/at/WOWforSocialChange. #WOWforSocialChange #WOWCapitalCampaign

Twitter - Build a better future with @WowDenver at igg.me/at/WOWforSocialChange. #WOWforSocialChange #WOWCapitalCampaign

Just remember: The average commercial kitchen is 17,000 square feet... Just enough room for a woman to turn her life around!

story:
My name is Kirsten Taylor, and I am a third year midwifery student at McMaster University in Hamilton, ON. I am originally from Nova Scotia and have a BSc in Neuroscience from Dalhousie University in Halifax. I like to think of myself as a person in three parts; dance artist, future midwife, and undeclared creator of handmade arts/clothes/knick-knacks/poetry.

I have an amazing opportunity this year to spend a month in Zaandam, Netherlands working and training with midwives. I will be traveling and spending the entire month of March in Zaandam...experiencing Dutch life, admiring tulips, and of course  catching beautiful babies for beautiful people. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for me; having the chance to study abroad in a country with a very established midwifery core is a dream come true, as well as flying overseas and being in Europe for the first time in my 24 years. I need some help getting there, as being a post-secondary student for...ugh 7 years now, takes its financial toll.

With your help and generosity, this trip can exist without my future financial crisis causing me tremendous stress and happening too soon! You all will also be helping my education in so many ways, effectively giving me the chance to become a versatile, and vivacious midwife when I graduate in May 2016. Allowing me to experience different models of midwifery care around the world aids me in becoming a better primary health care provider in my future career.

    For this trip I need $3300. My placement and learning is free as it's set up through the school, but I am in charge of paying for my flights and living expenses while in Zaandam.
    I have all kinds of perks set up for everyone who donates! Donating $10 and above gets you the handmade art/knick-knacks that I love to create. I even have a special midwifery perk too for all my classmates and midwives who choose to donate. Everything is one of a kind, just like all of us.
    All the funds raised will be going towards my trip...every single dollar and cent.

    This opportunity is very valuable. The Canadian midwifery system is based from the Dutch model, but in the Netherlands midwifery is a huge staple in their health care. In Canada, many people still are unsure what midwives do and how greatly we benefit the communities we serve. Hopefully through my campaign you can learn more about midwifery through curiosity and understand how midwifery is a necessity across the country, and worldwide.

    One day I could even catch you baby...and how cool would that be, knowing part of my training was with Dutch midwives!
      Having your support and donations will help me transition into my fourth year a little easier with less financial stress. Your support will really make this trip possible. Beyond everything, this experience going to make a huge difference for me.

        Please share this with everyone you know! All over all the social medias! The more the word is out there, and people are thinking about midwives, the better the awareness of how amazing this career is, and how life-changing learning aboard can be!

        You can find me on instagram and twitter @nrthrncrwn, and through Facebook.

story:
Instilling students with a desire to strengthen their understanding of financial matters while building their confidence and success in all areas of life is the mission of the Financial Literacy Summer Residential Program at UC Irvine. 

Who we are

We're members of the Center for Investment and Wealth Management at UC Irvine's Paul Merage School of Business and are creators of the Financial Literacy Summer Residential Program to provide deserving teens with an academic foundation in money and investment management.

More than 100 underserved youth in Orange, Los Angeles, and Riverside counties apply for the program each year. Students learn about basic budgeting, banking, credit, financial market comprehension along with career paths, educational options, networking and self-confidence enhancement - essential life skills not typically taught in school to most youth. 

What We Need

Our goal this year is to start setting up an endowment for the Financial Literacy Summer Residential Program at UC Irvine, and double the size of the program from 30 8th and 9th graders to over 60 next year. We need $25,000 to help us get started and support next year's program. 

Why do we need this money? 

We've built a fantastic program that students love, but we need your help to bring this program to more students. Our program is made possible by generous private donors and corporate sponsors. The program receives no UC or Merage School financial support. Your support will help give students an opportunity to experience a program that provides real-world context for learning and helps students connect their education with their future goals. For all of you supporting us through this campaign, we've got some exciting perks lined up for you on the right!

What is this Immersive Program?

This is a completely free-of-charge, six-day, on-campus immersive financial literacy program that is designed to: 

  • teach students financial literacy
  • empower their leadership potential
  • provide the tools, counseling and encouragement necessary to attend a four-year college or university
Here's a breakdown of the 3 main components of the program:

The Curriculum in the Classroom

The curriculum is broken down into 7 main parts in the classroom: 

  • Financial Literacy: Business Basics and Stock Portfolios
  • Preparing for High School: How to Set the Foundation for Life Goals
  • College 101: Determining the Right One for You
  • Career Planning: Find the Right Career Path Using Your Strengths, Interests and Skills
  • Networking: Successful Strategies and How to Use LinkedIn
  • Managing Your Money: Budgeting, Saving, Retirement, and Philanthropy
  • Presentation Skills: Giving a Winning Presentation

Real-World Exposure

  • Students visit Taco Bell headquarters for a glimpse into the corporate side of a familiar brand
  • PIMCO's executive team shows students the busy trading room floor
  • One of the corporations hosts a social etiquette dinner for students

The University Experience

  • Dorm living turns 30 strangers into new friends they can count on for a lifetime of encouragement
  • Students cheer on the UC Irvine Anteater athletes and hear from coaches about motivation and achieving goals
  • Outdoor ropes agility course promotes teamwork and self confidence in overcoming fears
  • An exercise class teaches challenges can be fun
  • Working within groups to create and deliver winning presentations
  • An exposure to life on the grounds of the university

The Students


The Financial Literacy Program in the Press

OC Registrar: 'UCI Financial Literacy summer program trains teenagers'
UC Irvine Merage School: 'Underprivileged 8th and 9th Graders Gain Life Skills Through Financial Literacy Summer Program'
Newswise: 'UCI's Business School kicks off Financial Literacy Summer Program'
Thrively Blog: 'If you don't give back no one will like you'
Arbonne Charitable Foundation: 'Arbonne Employees Help Teens Make a Great First Impression'
OC Metro: 'UCI aims to teach teens money management skills' 

Program Partners

Frequently Asked Questions

Are you a non-profit?  Is my contribution tax-deductible?

Yes, the financial literacy program runs with the UC Irvine Merage School and UC Irvine. Contributions are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. The tax ID number is 95-2540117. 

If donors are already supporting you, why should I help?
To date, we've been privileged to have the support of many generous individuals, corporations, and foundations. But to sustain our Financial Literacy Program for the long term, we need to engage parents and community members. All support we receive, regardless of the amount, will help further our mission and help us grow to reach more students.
How did this program start? 
We are truly grateful to Mr. Mark Moehlman, managing director for Beacon Pointe Wealth Advisors and founding chair of the Center for Investment and Wealth Management at the Paul Merage School of Business at the University of California, Irvine, whose passion for helping people guided the establishment of this program in 2011.

How many students have benefited so far? 
This program has benefited more than 120 students over the last four years and over 90% of the first year’s class is now applying to college.

Large Contributions - How can I make large donations? 
If you are interested in making a large contribution to the Financial Literacy program, please contact us at lmaki@uci.edu. 
I have more questions. Who do I ask? 
Please email us at lmaki@uci.edu to ask your question. We'll get back to you as soon as we can.

story:
Ciao, sono Matteo.

Come potete vedere nel video, sono un ex studente di fisica, che un anno fa ha scoporto una nuova passione per la sartoria e per la moda. 

Volendo continuare gli studi e ottenere una laurea, l'unica strada percorribile per me è frequentare un'accademia privata. Purtroppo però in Italia le leggi non permettono agli studenti che non hanno un adeguato supporto finanziario di frequentare certe accademie e, in questo modo, non gli permettono di seguire i propri sogni. Uno di questi studenti sono io, che ha ottenuto una borsa di studio, la quale però copre solamente un decimo della retta scolastica.

L'anno scorso, per curiosità, ho provato a cucire qualcosa. Ho iniziato con una cravatta per poi arrivare a realizzare un gilet. Ho scoperto così una passione che mi ha condotto a cambiare la strada che stavo seguendo. Ora sono capace di confezionare anche pantaloni, abitini e gonne. Per realizzare il mio sogno però ora ho bisogno di frequentare un'accademia di Fashion design.

Nonostante l'artigianato italiano sia conosciuto in tutto in mondo, qui in Italia non viene considerato così importante, e soprattutto non gli viene assegnato il giusto valore. Infatti lo stato e la politica non promuovendo l'artigianato, lo fanno morire.

L'accademia che vorrei frequentare è di Milano: " NABA - Nuova Accademia Di Belle Arti " che, tra l'altro, ha offerto una borsa di studio a 134 studenti meritivoli. Io ho partecipando al concorso ne ho vinta una. Purtroppo, come già detto, non è sufficente.


I costi che devo sostenere sono i seguenti : 

Costi annuali : 940 € tassa di iscrizione
  5.200 € prima tassa
  5.200 € seconda tasssa
  - 1.500 € borsa di studio 
  Per un totale di: 9.840 €
⦁   costo annuale per i trasporti : 1000 €

Per un totale in tre anni : 32.640 €



In cambio alla vostra offerta avrete :

- dai 5 ai 20 euro in cambio invierò una personale e-mail di ringraziamento

- con 20 euro realizzerò un portachiavi a forma di gilet

- con 60 euro un pappillon o una sciarpa realizzata con un tessuto a scelta.

- con 100 euro realizzerò tre pappillon o tre sciarpe.

- con 175 euro realizzerò un pantalone con un tessuto a scelta, come in foto.

- con 200 euro realizzerò un gilet da uomo o da donna con un tessuto pregiato a scleta.

- con 600 euro realizzerò un gilet con la coda, simile al frac.

- con 1000 euro realizzerò il gilet di Depero.

- con 3000 euro realizzerò una collezione di 10 gilet a scelta decisi assieme con l'aiuto di foto e disegni.


Nelle cifre sono comprese anche le spese di spedizione in tutto il mondo.


Inoltre invierò una e-mail per decidere il tessuto che preferite e per sapere le rispettive taglie e misure.


Grazie per il vostro aiuto.

______________________________________________________________________________


Hi, I'm Matteo.

As you can see in this video I am a former student of Physics who one year ago found out the beautiful passion of tailoring and for fashion. 
I have the scientific high school diploma and now I would like to graduate. Here in Italy, the only way to obtain a degree consistent with my passion is attending a private academy of Fashion Design. Unfortunately in this country, laws don’t let worthy students who come from the lower classes adequate financial support to attend private academy and in this way they don’t let this young people follow their dreams. One of this students is me, who has obtained a moderate scholarship to attend Fashion Design which covers just one tenth of the college tuition. 


What I Need 

Last year – out of curiosity – I tried to sew something, I started with ascots and bow tie, and then tried with waistcoats: I found a passion which led me to completely change the path I was following. I left the faculty of Physics and began to spend time with some professional tailors, who soon became dear friends of mine. Now, as I say in the vid, I am able to realise skirts, trousers, waistcoats for him and for her, dresses and a few accessories. Now I want  to become a professional tailor: in order to realise my dream, I need a degree in Fashion Design.

Although the Italian handicraft is well-know worldwide, here it is not considered to important, and it doesn’t get valued; in fact the State and the Politics do not promote artisans, causing people to ignore it and let it die. Therefore there are not many universities that launch faculties/courses consistent with any type of handicraft. Luckily I live near Milan, which offers a great variety of courses and among these there is Fashion Design. But again, the State does not help students with this kind of passion: this course is provided by a private academy, whose tuition is very high, at least for me.
The academy I would like to attend is the NABA (an abbreviation which stays for “new academy of fine arts”) that offers scholarships for particularly worthy students. I took part to the competition announcement and won one of the scholarships: unfortunately it is not high enough to really help me and my family pay the tuition, since it covers only one tenth of it.
Here is what and how much I have to pay: 


Here is what and how much I have to pay: 
⦁   Annual costs for the university: 940 € for the entry fee 
  5.200 € as first fee 
  5.200 € as second fee
  - 1.500 € of scholarship  
  Total amount: 9.840 € (which is
  more or less 10.856 $) 
⦁   Annual cost for transports: 1.000 € (which is more or less 
1.098 $) 

Since the graduation course lasts three years, the total cost of the university is 32.640 € (more or less 35.864 $) .

 What You Get   



If you would like to help me realise my dream I am committed to achieving you the following items of clothing: 
⦁    from 5 € to 19 €  you will receive a personal email of thanks.

⦁  With 20€ you will recive an handmade waistcoat key chain.


⦁   With 60€ I will realise for you one handmade bow tie and a scarf with a tissue chosen by you; 


⦁   With 100 € you will have three handmade bow ties or three handmade scarves with three different tissue chosen by you; 
⦁   With 175 € I will realise a woman pants with a tight tissue chosen by you.


⦁   With 200 € I will sew an handmade tailored waistcoat for him or for her, with a fine tissue chosen by you. 


⦁   With 600 € I will realise for you a wonderful handmade tailored waistcoat with tie, with a fine tissue chosen by you.


⦁  With 1000 € I will realise a Depero waistcoat as in picture. It's a real artwork.


⦁   with 3000€ or more I will realise for you a collection of ten handmade personalised and tailored waistcoat combined with bow tie and decided with you and with the help of picture and photos, or some other personalized dress chosen togheter.


I will send you an e-mail with all the available tissues so that you can chose which you prefer.
 

All shipping costs are included in the offers.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also contribute sharing my facebook post. Your help is essential for me.

Thank You
story_txt:
Ciao, sono Matteo.Come potete vedere nel video, sono un ex studente di fisica, che un anno fa ha scoporto una nuova passione per la sartoria e per la moda. Volendo continuare gli studi e ottenere una laurea, l'unica strada percorribile per me è frequentare un'accademia privata. Purtroppo però in Italia le leggi non permettono agli studenti che non hanno un adeguato supporto finanziario di frequentare certe accademie e, in questo modo, non gli permettono di seguire i propri sogni. Uno di questi studenti sono io, che ha ottenuto una borsa di studio, la quale però copre solamente un decimo della retta scolastica.L'anno scorso, per curiosità, ho provato a cucire qualcosa. Ho iniziato con una cravatta per poi arrivare a realizzare un gilet. Ho scoperto così una passione che mi ha condotto a cambiare la strada che stavo seguendo. Ora sono capace di confezionare anche pantaloni, abitini e gonne. Per realizzare il mio sogno però ora ho bisogno di frequentare un'accademia di Fashion design.Nonostante l'artigianato italiano sia conosciuto in tutto in mondo, qui in Italia non viene considerato così importante, e soprattutto non gli viene assegnato il giusto valore. Infatti lo stato e la politica non promuovendo l'artigianato, lo fanno morire.L'accademia che vorrei frequentare è di Milano: " NABA - Nuova Accademia Di Belle Arti " che, tra l'altro, ha offerto una borsa di studio a 134 studenti meritivoli. Io ho partecipando al concorso ne ho vinta una. Purtroppo, come già detto, non è sufficente.I costi che devo sostenere sono i seguenti : Costi annuali : 940 € tassa di iscrizione  5.200 € prima tassa  5.200 € seconda tasssa  - 1.500 € borsa di studio    Per un totale di: 9.840 € ⦁   costo annuale per i trasporti : 1000 € Per un totale in tre anni : 32.640 €In cambio alla vostra offerta avrete :- dai 5 ai 20 euro in cambio invierò una personale e-mail di ringraziamento- con 20 euro realizzerò un portachiavi a forma di gilet- con 60 euro un pappillon o una sciarpa realizzata con un tessuto a scelta.- con 100 euro realizzerò tre pappillon o tre sciarpe.- con 175 euro realizzerò un pantalone con un tessuto a scelta, come in foto.- con 200 euro realizzerò un gilet da uomo o da donna con un tessuto pregiato a scleta.- con 600 euro realizzerò un gilet con la coda, simile al frac.- con 1000 euro realizzerò il gilet di Depero.- con 3000 euro realizzerò una collezione di 10 gilet a scelta decisi assieme con l'aiuto di foto e disegni.Nelle cifre sono comprese anche le spese di spedizione in tutto il mondo.Inoltre invierò una e-mail per decidere il tessuto che preferite e per sapere le rispettive taglie e misure.Grazie per il vostro aiuto.______________________________________________________________________________Hi, I'm Matteo.As you can see in this video I am a former student of Physics who one year ago found out the beautiful passion of tailoring and for fashion. I have the scientific high school diploma and now I would like to graduate. Here in Italy, the only way to obtain a degree consistent with my passion is attending a private academy of Fashion Design. Unfortunately in this country, laws don’t let worthy students who come from the lower classes adequate financial support to attend private academy and in this way they don’t let this young people follow their dreams. One of this students is me, who has obtained a moderate scholarship to attend Fashion Design which covers just one tenth of the college tuition. 
What I Need 

Last year – out
of curiosity – I tried to sew something, I started with ascots and bow tie, and
then tried with waistcoats: I found a passion which led me to completely change
the path I was following. I left the faculty of Physics and began to spend time
with some professional tailors, who soon became dear friends of mine. Now, as I
say in the vid, I am able to realise skirts, trousers, waistcoats for him and for
her, dresses and a few accessories. Now I want 
to become a professional tailor: in order to realise my dream, I need a
degree in Fashion Design. 
Although the
Italian handicraft is well-know worldwide, here it is not considered to
important, and it doesn’t get valued; in fact the State and the Politics do not
promote artisans, causing people to ignore it and let it die. Therefore there
are not many universities that launch faculties/courses consistent with any
type of handicraft. Luckily I live near Milan, which offers a great variety of
courses and among these there is Fashion Design. But again, the State does not
help students with this kind of passion: this course is provided by a private
academy, whose tuition is very high, at least for me. 
The academy I would like to attend is the NABA (an abbreviation which stays for
“new academy of fine arts”) that offers scholarships for particularly worthy
students. I took part to the competition announcement and won one of the
scholarships: unfortunately it is not high enough to really help me and my
family pay the tuition, since it covers only one tenth of it. 
Here is what and how much I have to pay: 

Here is what and how much I have to pay: ⦁   Annual costs for the university: 940 € for the entry fee   5.200 € as first fee   5.200 € as second fee  - 1.500 € of scholarship    Total amount: 9.840 € (which is  more or less 10.856 $) ⦁   Annual cost for transports: 1.000 € (which is more or less 1.098 $) Since the graduation course lasts three years, the total cost of the university is 32.640 € (more or less 35.864 $) .
 What You Get   
If you would like to help me realise my dream I am committed to achieving you the following items of clothing: ⦁    from 5 € to 19 €  you will receive a personal email of thanks.
⦁  With 20€ you will recive an handmade waistcoat
key chain.



⦁   With 60€ I will realise for you one handmade bow tie and a scarf with a tissue chosen by you; 


⦁   With 100 € you will have three handmade bow ties or three handmade scarves with three different tissue chosen by you; ⦁   With 175 € I will realise a woman pants with a tight tissue chosen by you.

⦁   With 200 € I will sew an handmade tailored waistcoat for him or for her, with a fine tissue chosen by you. 


⦁   With 600 € I will realise for you a wonderful handmade tailored waistcoat with tie, with a fine tissue chosen by you.

⦁  With 1000 € I will realise a Depero waistcoat as in picture. It's a real artwork.

⦁   with 3000€ or more I will realise for you a collection of ten handmade personalised and tailored waistcoat combined with bow tie and decided with you and with the help of picture and photos, or some other personalized dress chosen togheter.I will send you an e-mail with all the available tissues so that you can chose which you prefer. All shipping costs are included in the offers.
Other Ways You Can Help
You can also contribute sharing my facebook post. Your help is essential for me.
Thank You

story:
Hey Friends!


For those of who don't know me, my name is Kenton Gott and I am a Chicago based actor. I've had  a few experiences volunteering/teaching, twice internationally on trips to Ukraine. My last trip was spent teaching English and Drama in Kharkov, Ukraine at a summer camp for local orphanages in July 2011.

Through the help of Volunteers Initiative Nepal (VIN), I'll be able to help abroad once again. VIN's mission "is to empower marginalized communities, with a focus on women and children, through enhanced educational programs and community training to promote equality, economic well-being and basic human rights." 


During my trip, I will spend one month at a buddhist monastery on the outskirts of Kathmandu, where I'll be teaching english to junior and senior monks. My next Month will be spent in the Jitpur community outside Kathmandu where I will be teaching english, rights and life skills to local women as a part of VIN's "Women's Empowerment Program."  

Trip Duration: September 15-November 9

Now this is where YOU come in. Nepal is quite literally on the other side of the planet and tickets cost a great deal($700-900 each way). Also, I will need to gather money for the organizational fee's (transportation, training, housing etc.). VIN is a non-government, non-profit organization and is completely dependent on volunteering and outside funding for its programs and staff. 

EVERY DONATION COUNTS!

I should be clear: My actual goal is closer to $2,400.00, but due to possible website fee's I've chosen to post a lower amount. I'll be raising money through other means: Letters, Events etc. So keep your eyes peeled. 

I cannot express how vital every ounce of support is. For example $100 will pay for my housing expenses for 3 weeks or my overall transportation costs on the ground during my stay.

 Once we meet the funding goal-and we will meet it my friends-I will be making sure every additional dollar goes towards VIN's Women's Empowerment Program. To put that in perspective, even if we only get $100 over the goal, that money will fund the activities of one women's group for a MONTH! So please know every donation means something. 

INCENTIVES: Depending on your donation amount, you'll get something different from my travels.
  • $25-Nepalese Postcard 
  • $50-Trinkets from a Kathmandu market
  • $100-Printed photo of someone your money has helped, and a personal Thank you from me. 

OTHER SUPPORT:

While money does contribute a great deal, there are countless other means if you wish to support my adventure or VIN. I accept positive vibes, prayer, advice, lent supplies/gear, or any form of old fashioned friendship. 


WHY NEPAL?


Nepal is already one of the poorest countries in Asia, and while it has been making strides towards modernization in recent years, that was significantly impeaded this spring. On April 25th, a 7.8 magnitude earthquake struck central Nepal, killing over 9,000 people, injuring over 23,000, and displacing countless more. While I did have knowledge of this country previously and heard of the events, I must admit this whole process has all been rather serendipitous. If you had told me I'd be doing this six months ago, I'd think you were crazy. But, I saw a need, asked questions, and said yes to what I feel is a global call to help those who are in need. I cannot be sure what my actual impact will be. Such things can't be measured on a graph. But I do know that I'm going on this adventure to help my brothers and sisters in Nepal. All I can do is venture on with an open mind and a willing heart. 


MORE INFO:

If you want to contribute further, learn more about the mission, or even volunteer yourself, feel free to visit: http://www.volunteersinitiativenepal.org/

story:
27 Mayan students need sponsors by January. Those students who are not sponsored will drop out of school  when the 2015 school year begins in January. 

And it's not just about keeping them in school.  We have a plan to do more.

El Pueblo Iluminado (Brightening the Barrio) works with the 26 most impoverished families the Maya-K’iche village of Chuatroj located in the mountains of Western Guatemala. Together with Chuatroj’s education administrators, we are turning the school into a hub for actions that empower students and families to transform their livelihoods.

** Thank you to the Honorary Consul of Guatemala in West Palm Beach, Florida for continually supporting El Pueblo Iluminado! ** 

Chuatroj has made impressive strides to reduce poverty and improve literacy and health in the past 10 years.  We began working directly with Chuatroj’s leaders and schools 7 years ago after we were drawn by their desire to take their community’s poverty into their own hands and not wait on others to do it for them.

El Pueblo Iluminado is a fruit of that labor and is based on the premise of "a hand-up, not a hand-out." Together we dream of a village that it 100% illuminated, where no one is left behind and no one goes it alone. In September 2014, Chuatroj’s elementary, middle, and high schools administrations came together to form the “Pro-Maya Education Inter-institutional Education Committee” with the belief that secondary education is key to sustainably transform the quality of life of the most excluded Mayan-K’iche families in Guatemala’s Western Highlands.  

The 27 students selected for the scholarship program represent 134 family members who live on an average of $0.34 per day.  With secondary school being privatized, in January they won't be able afford to continue school.  We can't let that happen.  Each family member sacrifices when school tuition is paid although food is scarce or when someone is sick.  They have made this sacrifice because they believe that education is the solution.  And it's true.  If these students don't graduate, they will repeat the same cycle as adults... and so will their children... and their grandchildren... 

How can one student in secondary school be the change agent that pulls their family out of poverty? Isn't that kind of solution expensive? 



The solution is a Conditioned Scholarship Program that will:

  1. Increase the number of Maya-K’iche’ youth whose education qualifies them for the national job market;
  2. Increase the number of Maya-K’iche’ children who have access to healthcare during their critical growth period.
  3. Contribute to immediate improvements in nutrition, medical care, and housing conditions for the most excluded families .
  4. Guarantee that these youth have a financial cushion available upon reaching adulthood which can be used to pursue university studies, pursue job interests, etc.
Here's how it works. 
  • Each of the 27 students receives an annual scholarship, to cover school-related expenses and contribute to improving nutrition and healthcare by allowing the family to diversify their spending. 
  • The scholarship will be awarded as a monthly stipend deposited to the head-of-household.
  • A percentage of the scholarship must be deposited in a savings account for the child. 

We need 27 student sponsors by January. Those students who are not sponsored will drop out of school in when the 2015 school year begins in January. 

An annual sponsorship costs $365 or $1 per day.  It may seem cliché, but that's really how the budget breaks down. 
We would be honored for you to sponsor a student in honor or memory of a loved one, and we thank you for considering giving sponsorships as Christmas gifts this year.
Risks & Challenges

With youth who live in such precarious circumstances there's always the risk that they may be forced to put their studies on hold despite our support.  We take a preventive approach to overcoming this risk by regularly monitoring each student's situation. This way we can anticipate possible threats and take steps to avoid them.

Our monitoring team holds families and students accountable for properly using the scholarship. Students will be evaluated quarterly.

  • Regular school attendance is non-negotiable. 
  • Students who are found to be working during school hours will be dismissed from the program.
  • Families must show that the costs this scholarship has offset have been used to improve their most immediate needs.

Our motto of "community united, no family left behind" means that no one goes the road alone. As part of the program our students now have a larger, stronger network supporting them. When Chuatroj's Scholarship Committee was formed each member committed himself and the school he represents to doing everything possible to ensure that each student in the program graduates from high school.

Who "we" are

The “Chuatroj Inter-Institutional Pro-Mayan Education Scholarship Committee” manages and monitors the program in Chuatroj.  The committee is represented by administrators from Chuatroj’s elementary, middle, and high schools:

  • Escuela Oficial Rural Mixta
  • Instituto Mixto de Educación Básico de Chuatroj
  • Instituto Mixto de Educación Diversificado de Chuatroj

The Central American Institute for Social Science and Development –INCEDES-, a Guatemalan non-profit organization, provides administrative and consulting support for Chuatroj’s Scholarship Committee and coordinates fundraising efforts.  www.incedes.org.gt

The Florida Atlantic University Corn Maya Club collaborates with INCEDES to coordinate fundraising efforts.

Help us spread the word!
  • Like our Facebook page and share it with your friends.
  • Share our project at your holiday table, with your church, temple, or mosque.

story:
Who We Are:
  • I am a 25-year old peace corps volunteer from Boulder, Colorado.  I've been in Kaffrine, Senegal for 2 years, teaching health practices focusing on children's nutrition and malaria prevention.  Kaffrine is a region in central Senegal, with a dry hot climate and a population about 500,000.


  • The garden will be used to educate students at a middle school in a small village in central Senegal about proper gardening techniques, and the vegetables grown will be given for the students at lunch. Many of the teachers are interested in working at the garden, and the teachers have proposed that  each of seven takes responsibility for the garden for one day per week. So far the students have shown initiative by clearing out the field, have been following instruction, and have been watering the seedbeds under teacher supervision.
What We Need & What You Get
  • The money will be used to purchase supplies including a fence, hoses, watering cans, fertilizer, seeds, labor in preparing seed beds, and water barrels.
  • We need a minimum of $360 for the project, with any extra going to future supplies including seeds.

The Impact

  • With proper instruction in nutrition and the vegetables from this garden, students are learning to be self sufficient.  The Kaffrine region is the most malnourished in Senegal, with a significant number of small children suffering from all stages of malnutrition.

Risks & Challenges

  • Ensuring that the ground is well taken of after I depart Senegal will require good training of both the teachers and the students.
  • I will transfer knowledge of the garden to the Peace Corps volunteer taking over after me in this town.  The teachers are very motivated and I'll make sure that they are well trained an know what to do.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't afford to donate now, please let others know about this campaign.  Your email, shares, tweets, and pins can help us reach our goal.

(Note: In Bryce's area he has no internet access except on trips to the regional capital, so his dad is helping manage this campaign for him)

story:
Short Summary

eWORLDCLASS is being developed to facilitate opportunities through education for Jamaican children, grade 1 through grade 6. This online educational resource is intended to address weaknesses in the critical subject areas of Mathematics, Language Arts and Communication Task. This online knowledge base resource is not just for a child to be test-ready but for the child to understand the fundamentals and to possess the confidence at an early stage of their development for success and leadership skills.

What We Need

Let's break it down :

  • The greatest gift we can give to a child is the gift that keeps on giving. Knowledge! We will work with other stakeholders with benefits to kids in mind.
If we can get our children to understand, that it's about competing against the 100% and not against their classmates, then we will have done our job at eWorldClass. 

The Impact

We’re often left in the dust due to the fact that we think we’re not good enough or simply that the rest of the world has it all.

The game has changed with technology fast becoming the new tool for global growth. Now everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed. Online testing and educational resources will only pick up momentum due to the fundamental value it offers. We can now expect our youth to carry the torch forward, now that the foundation for success is being laid for them. Our youth must take full advantage of this great opportunity with the help and guidance of their parent, guardian, educator and stakeholder for a brighter future.

Other Ways You Can Help

Success will come in the form of contributions which go mostly towards marketing the service. Traditional marketing will include print ads, audio and video. We will also be relying on social media and word-of- mouth. These are additional ways to contribute with or without funding. Any form of positive marketing and advertising is equally important

Arts and Communication Task. This online knowledge base resource is not just
for a child to be test-ready but for the child to understand the fundamentals
and to possess the confidence at an early stage of their development for
success and leadership skills.   What We Need 
 
Let's break it down :

The greatest gift we can give to a child is the gift that
     keeps on giving. Knowledge! We will work with other stakeholders with
     benefits to kids in mind.


If we can get our children to understand, that it's about competing against the 100% and not against their classmates, then we will have done our job at eWorldClass.    The Impact 

We’re often left in the dust due to
the fact that we think we’re not good enough or simply that the rest of the
world has it all.
The game has changed with technology
fast becoming the new tool for global growth. Now everyone has an equal
opportunity to succeed. Online testing and educational resources will only pick
up momentum due to the fundamental value it offers. We can now expect our youth
to carry the torch forward, now that the foundation for success is being laid
for them. Our youth must take full advantage of this great opportunity with the
help and guidance of their parent, guardian, educator and stakeholder for a
brighter future.
   
Other Ways You Can Help

 Success
will come in the form of contributions which go mostly towards marketing the
service. Traditional marketing will include print ads, audio and video. We will
also be relying on social media and word-of- mouth. These are additional ways
to contribute with or without funding. Any form of positive marketing and
advertising is equally important

story:
What is Youth Explosion?

Youth Explosion is run by a Lynchburg, Virginia-based ministry named Emmaus Road Ministries (ERM). Emmaus Road serves as a parachurch organization connecting local churches in the community to reach the lost together as one church.

Youth Explosion is the primary event of Emmaus Road Ministries. We will provide the program necessary to reach the lost and create a “camp” atmosphere including games, dramas, videos, worship, and a speaker. There will also be sessions to encourage, train, and provide pastors, volunteer leaders, and parents with solid follow up plans/curriculum in order to disciple every student who makes a decision during Youth Explosion. We believe that the most important part of the ministry is what takes place after the event so this is why we are more than just an event that creates an emotional decision – we want to make sure the local churches are trained and ready to make disciples after the event is over. We exist to connect unchurched students to a local church and to serve as the catalyst to spark the decision for discipleship.

Additionally, this year we are creating a Christ-centered short-film to help the youth better understand the Gospel! We know that the young people of today are driven by media, and what better way to help them understand Salvation than a film that focuses on relatable people as they seek to understand the meaning of death, salvation, sin, redemption, guilt, and Christ’s justification.

Our hope and prayer is to be able to expand Youth Explosion to even more sites to reach more communities and students with the Gospel of Jesus Christ. We plan to do this by putting a team together that will be able to travel to these communities and facilitate the events. We also are working on a Youth Explosion curriculum that local churches would be able to purchase and use to host their own Youth Explosion events.

Last year, 15 youth accepted Christ, with dozens of recommitments, baptisms, and dedications to the ministry! We believe that the Lord is going to work in even greater ways this year.

What are our needs?

Our mission is to take the gospel to as many youth as possible this summer, and any donation you give will go towards three primary expenses:

  1. We covet your prayers! Please be praying that God would continue to bless the ministry and would guide all those involved in the planning process. We want this to grow as big as whatever God wants it to be, whether it be a few events a year or dozens. We are just going to be faithful and continue to grow it as He allows.
  2. The purchase of a van in which to transport youth leaders to each location. While we’re based in Virginia, we have plans to travel as far as Vermont this summer, and hopefully to further locations if the Lord opens the door!
  3. The general supplies/food that it takes to run Youth Explosion at each location.
  4. The film production costs of creating our Gospel-centered film.

How can we thank you?

While most of the outcomes of Youth Explosion will be intangible – Lord-willing, the changed lives of many youth for His Kingdom! – we would like to offer you a few of the items that the youth will also have access to this summer. Since we’re making a movie for the youth, what better way than for you to be a part of the fruits of the filmmaking process!​

·        $10 - Name in Movie Credits as a Sponsor

·        $25 - Name in Movie Credits as a Sponsor, & DVD of the Film

·        $50 - Name in Movie Credits as a Sponsor, & DVD of the Film, & Digital Movie Poster

·        $100 - Name in Movie Credits as a Sponsor, & DVD of the Film, & Digital Movie Poster, & Youth Explosion T-Shirt, 

 

Thank you so much for your consideration and prayer. We can’t wait share with you how the Lord works this summer!

In Christ,

The Youth Explosion Team

story:
Dom Jones (panelist) and friends, OBF 2015.

“By the end of the day, my mind was overflowing with ideas and my heart was bursting with civic pride.” —Dashka Slater, journalist, novelist, children’s author

“Full houses at all panels and readings, often standing room only. Beautifully organized.”—PEN Oakland

“This is the book festival the East Bay has been waiting for!”—Nayomi Munaweera, novelist

“Where can a war reporter share an intense conversation about war and violence—with two novelists—and continue the discussion in the sunshine over bratwursts from the food truck outside? Only at the Oakland Book Festival.”—Mark Danner, journalist 

“A conclave convened upon a kaleidoscopic aural summit sans the rhetoric of commercial devitalization.”—Will Alexander, poet

Free. Open. Public. 

The second annual Oakland Book Festival will take place at Oakland City Hall on Sunday, May 22nd, 2016, with more than 90 journalists, novelists, historians, poets, editors, critics, artists, philosophers, and memoirists in over 50 discussions on labor, immigration, drug trafficking, gentrification, censorship, prisons, restorative justice, wealth and inequality, policing, agricultural production, education, glass ceilings, civil disobedience, altruism, activism, and freedom. 

This is your festival: help us realize it, then come and join it.

Audience, Hearing Room 2, City Hall, OBF 2015.

2015’s inaugural Oakland Book Festival was voted Best New Cultural Event  by the readers of the East Bay Express. 

It featured the Bay Area’s own Elaine Brown, Vikram Chandra, Anna Lappé, Khafre James, Gary Kamiya, and Anthony Marra. It also brought to Oakland national and international authors such as Edwidge Danticat, Héctor Tobar, Tracy K. Smith, Lewis Lapham, Paul Beatty, and Astra Taylor. 

Partnering publications and organizations included the Oakland Public Library, PEN Oakland, The Nation, Mother Jones, ZYZZYVA, UC Press, Children’s Fairyland, Litquake, and Chapter 510 & the Dept. of Make Believe, all of whom curated panels and readings featuring their authors and editors. 

This year’s Festival is even more ambitious. 

Support the OBF in 2016

Attendees, City Hall, OBF 2015.

The Oakland Book Festival needs your help to return to City Hall and to expand its program in 2016. 

In addition to general operating costs, our goal of $25,000 will fund:

Travel and accommodations for our visiting authors. We want to show Oakland off to a world of writers—and to feed and house them while they are visiting us.

A children’s stage at the Festival. Dedicated entirely to young people and their interests, the OBF Children’s Stage will feature readings, events, games, and crafts in partnership with the Oakland Public Library, Children’s Fairyland, MOCHA, Kidquake, and Chapter 510 & the Dept. of Make Believe. 

The building and maintenance of a robust Festival website. Apart from providing Festival information and details, our website will host a video archive of interviews, readings, and discussions that will become a resource for educators, researchers, and writers—as well as a means to share the Festival’s activities with a wider audience.

Food and drink for our essential “day-of-Festival” staff. The OBF would not be possible without the 100+ volunteers who hand out programs, shepherd authors, and monitor panel rooms. Help us support them. 

OPL librarian reading at the Children’s Stage, OBF 2015. 

What we do. Why we need you.

"Lake Merritt and Utopia” panel, City Hall, OBF 2015.

Dedicated to books, ideas, and the pleasures of literacy, the Oakland Book Festival serves the reading public, encourages debate, and celebrates the City of Oakland. 

The Festival transforms City Hall’s council chambers and hearing rooms into public forums where panelists convene to discuss current events, politics, art, literature, history, and—most of all—Oakland itself. Panels are moderated by experts and are oriented toward provoking debate and conversation with the audience. More than a literary trade show or a series of readings, the Festival asks authors to discuss ideas, to bring their expertise to bear, to share their experience: to challenge, elevate, and inspire one another and those in attendance. 

All events at 2015’s OBF were free and open to the public. Attendees were not asked to make reservations or purchase tickets in advance. The Oakland Book Festival is a community event. We aim to keep it that way, and we need your help to do so. Please give now.


Edwidge Danticat, City Hall Council Chambers, OBF 2015. 

Other ways you can help

  • Volunteer. We are looking for good literary-minded people to join us in helping coordinate and run the Festival. Write us at info@oaklandbookfestival.org if you would like to join our team.
  • Like us and share our event and this campaign on Facebook and Twitter
  • Send this ask to your friends, family, and mailing lists.

Volunteers, City Hall, OBF 2015.

The Oakland Book Festival was founded in 2015 by Timothy Don and Kira Brunner Don and is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit dedicated to education, literacy, and public discourse. All donations are tax deductible.

story:
Every individual and educational community should have the means to make a real and lasting difference with students on a day-to-day basis.

Do you know people who have a passionate commitment to education and are continually thwarted?  How can you support them in fulfilling their aspirations?

Every day talented, resourceful people face seemingly insurmountable obstacles to making a real and lasting difference with students.  When standard solutions are ineffective, over time these people whittle down their aspirations, become overwhelmed, cynical and resigned.

The Education Network delivers a unique methodology that has enabled thousands of people to consistently achieve and sustain results in education that previously seemed unimaginable, impossible, or too time-consuming to attempt.  We are seeking $5000 to develop the internet capacity to make our methodology and its benefits widely available to people who would otherwise not have access to it.

We will use the funds to create and maintain a new website with components where people can engage in enlivening, thought-provoking discussions that generate innovations, rather than rehash and rearrange old formulas.  And they can discover how to create the kind of environment where learning takes place in the most profound sense of the word - with less struggle and frustration, and more joy and satisfaction.

Daily thousands of individuals and groups, from classroom teachers to national government agencies, grapple with the challenges of redesigning education to meet the needs of all students while simultaneously educating the most complex generation in history.  But with all of the intelligent thinking, purposeful effort, and best intentions, in far too many instances these people are only able to make incremental improvements, or at best periodically produce extraordinary results that can't be sustained.  In short, there is very little real change.  Over time these dedicated, talented people become overwhelmed, cynical, resigned, whittle down their aspirations, and in some cases, leave the profession.

THE EDUCATION NETWORK, a national nonprofit 501(c)3 organization, exists to fulfill two objectives.  One, to empower people to realize their fundamental commitment to education - to make a real and lasting difference with each and every student on a day-to-day basis.  Two, to alter the conversations that shape educational reform in this country such that truly substantive changes can be invented and successfully implemented, leading to education reaching its full potential.

To achieve these objectives, The Education Network does not offer a prescribed model or a set of strategies for taking action.  Instead, we have developed a unique methodology to thinking, speaking and listening that allows people to approach issues from a new perspective.  As a result, they have the ability to make what they envision a reality - with less struggle and frustration, and more joy and satisfaction.

We are inviting you to partner with us by providing the funds necessary to make this methodology more widely available.  For over thirty years, The Education Network has offered training programs in a distinctive set of skills that directly impact people's ability to bring a spirit of brilliance and creativity to the complex challenges that exist in classrooms, and to sustain their energy as they navigate the education system.  Thousands of participants in our programs have been able to apply these skills swiftly and naturally to:

  • Create learning environments that cultivate student participation and responsibility for their own education, resulting in remarkable gains in achievement.
  • Provide leadership and inspiration in initiatives resulting in effective collaboration with colleagues, higher quality solutions to instructional problems, and successful implementation of school and district-wide projects.
Testimonials:

     A Junior High School Teacher: One of the most exciting things my participation has done is change the lives of the students in my school.  The majority of the students I work with are considered "at risk."  Just hearing that phrase conjures up a lot of things.  The training I have received has made it possible for my students to accomplish things people never believed possible. For example, one of my classes made a promise to hand in all of their assignments for an entire term.  That translates into 37 students handing in 43 assignments.  They did it!!!  You can imagine how fulfilling that was for them. One young man's comment was, "If we can do that, we can do anything."

     A first-year intern in an elementary school: By December I wanted to leave the school.  I hated my students.  I hated my mentor.  I hated everything.  I especially hated staying at school until seven o'clock every night.  I felt like I was working so hard and that nothing ever changed.  When I started .... [participating with The Education Network] I was very cynical .... but my attitude did a 180.  Changes in my classes were slow in coming, but the change in my attitude seemed like it came overnight.  I realized that I really did have what it took to be what I wanted to be.  Thanks to .... [this program] I left the year knowing I could enjoy being a teacher again.

Currently, only people who live in communities where one of our trained volunteers deliver our programs have access to this methodology.  To respond to requests from people in other communities, these same volunteers have taken on a project to remove this constraint.  We are going to redesign our website with social media components, such as a blog and a forum, that will give people the opportunity to:

  1.  Engage in conversations based upon our methodology as a means of generating innovative ideas and solutions to the challenges they face, and of expanding their ability to fulfill their commitments to students and the education system.
  2. Participate in conversations that can alter the national conversation for what is possible in education.  These conversations will explore questions like:
Why is there such a disparity between what people envision producing when they undertake a project that could significantly impact the quality of education, and what they actually achieve?  Why do they often end up reproducing something that looks very much like what they had before?  Why is there so little real change?  More fundamentally, why is there such a disparity between what is possible in education and what is actually happening?  


Additionally, the redesigned website will give us the opportunity to dramatically increase participation in fulfilling our current objectives: deliver our programs in more communities, build our team of volunteers, become involved in initiatives and acquire financial support.

We are seeking $5000 by August 26 for this project.  The funds will be used for the services of a professional website developer, creating new materials for the site, and maintaining the site.  Anything you can contribute would be greatly appreciated.  Let your donation be a full expression of your commitment to transform education in the United States.  If you can't contribute money, you can help by sharing this with your friends and getting the word out to those who have the means.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi my name is India Sposato. I am the club president of the Unatti Club of Agoura High. I help lead a  few charitable organizations that have helped further lives. When I met Stephanie Waisler, the head of the Unatti Foundation, and visited the home I knew that this was an opportunity that was extremely important. I immediately wanted to help raise money for this foundation. This Spring I am going back to the home. I want to bring the girls money and hope, so they are inspired to strive for their dreams.
  • This home raises 21 girls, ages 4 to 19 years old. Unatti is soon taking in 4 more girls. Unlike the abusive situations these girls once lived in, this home creates a long-term, loving family. They are provided with a safe and supportive environment to eat, sleep, learn, play and live. 
  • One of the main things that attracted me to this foundation is that the girls are given an incredible chance to get an education. Nepal is a male dominated world, and educating these girls while taking them out of poverty is the next step to fixing issues this country has. 

  • While I was at Unatti the girls got in a line and told us their aspirations.

    My aspiration is to be a cardiovascular doctor.

    My aspiration is to be a pilot.

    My aspiration is to be a nurse.

    My aspiration is to be an air hostess.

    This foundation provides a great home for these girls. We need to help these girls acheive their dreams and they need money to be educated.

  • The Unatti Home also has an Arts and Music Center, where the homeless children of Bhaktapur, Nepal are able to have a creative outlet. Children who are trapped in the cycle of extreme poverty and limited opportunity nevertheless are encouraged to express themselves honestly, fearlessly, and happily, incorporating both local and Western artistic approaches and traditions. 
  • In addition the Foundation provides jobs and  free English and Nepali literacy classes to adult women living in Bhaktapur.
  • The Unatti Foundation lifts up the community through education. It uses this powerful tool to help a poverty stricken community. The foundation is not investing in multiple areas, so it is focused on helping this one important place. It furthers the lives of specific girls, while improving the area. By contributing you can be a main cause in the advancement of this community and these girls lives. You will be able to see the affects and change in 18 girls lives. You will contribute to furthering and altering the situation that these girls were born into.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I hope to raise at least $2000 dollars, because this can pay for a multitude of important supplies for the foundation. Some of which are common necessities, and others are for the new home that Unatti is moving to. (This new place will allow 10 more girls to live at the home). By raising $2000 dollars we will be able to give money to a combination of these needs.
  • $25.00 feeds a child 3 meals a day for a month
  • $40.00 affords nutritious snacks for 50 students at Unatti Art & Music Center
  • $100.00 buys water for an entire year for our Unatti Group Home for Girls
  • $225.00 buys a new dresser
  • $300.00 buys a new double bed
  • $550.00 affords our college bound girls school supplies, books and food for an entire year.
  • $1450.00 affords one year sponsorship for a girl in the Unatti Group Home for Girls. 
  • $1800.00 buys office furniture for the new Unatti office

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar counts, but if you cannot contribute it is not a problem.

  • You can tell all of your friends. Letting just a couple people know will spread the awareness of this foundation.
  • Share this site on all of your social media!

Thanks so much!!!!

THE PERKS

Perk #2 - $15 donation

Everything from Tier #1 plus....  Authentic Postcard from Nepal


Perk #3 - $25 donation

Everything from tiers #1 and #2 plus....

A hand crafted Nepali Bracelet made from glass beads. These bracelets are exchanged to show friendship and love in the Nepali culture


Perk #4 - $35 donation

Everything from tiers #1 and #2 plus....

Nepali Prayer Wheel - Each spin is a prayer! Spin your way to Nirvana while you help the Unatti foundation feed, clothe and educate young Nepali women! You're on your way to illumination.


Perk #5 - $50 donation

Everything from tiers #1, 2 and 3 plus....

A Hand Drawn 'Thank You' card from one of the Unatti Girls.


Perk #6 - $75 donation

Everything from tiers #1 and #2 plus....

MalaBead Necklace. Hand made wood beads in necklace form. A classic. AND... Colorful Nepali Prayer Flags are an iconic part of the Nepali culture. They bring both a beauty and spiritual joy to any household.

              



Perk #7 - $100 donation

Everything from tiers #1, 2 and 3 plus.....

A Hand Woven Wool Hat! These colorful wool hats are super warm for those cool or cold nights and feature wild colors and designs in the Nepali style... love, happiness and warmth.


Perk #8 - $150 donation

Everything from tiers #1, 2, 3 and 4 plus.....

A Hand Embroidered T Shirt featuring either the infamous "Wisdom Eyes" from a Stupa in Nepal or another beautiful design.Various colors, and designs. Please specify size.



Perk #9 - $250 donation
Everything from tiers #1, 2, 3, 4 and 7 plus.....
A Personalized 'thank you' Video from the Unatti Girls Club of Agoura High AND a 'thank you' shout out from the Unatti Girls themselves... in Nepal!!!


Perk #10 - $500 donation

Everything from ALL the previous tiers plus.....

An original piece of Indian Artwork! Approximately 8"x10" in size and suitable for framing. Scenes typically include hunting in the jungle, deity worship or historical processions of royalty. Add some Indian culture to your home!


Perk #11 - $1000 donation - Be an ANGEL

Every perk ALL the previous tiers plus.....PLUS...

A Skype "Meet and Greet" tour of the Unatti Home and the girls who live there. Talk with the children and see how you are impacting their lives and making a change.

ALSO.... A beautiful, soft, warm and very stylish Handwoven Shawl that was handcrafted by Nepali women who work closely with Unatti. Unatti strives to provide jobs and opportunities to the women who live and work in Nepal. Know that you have provided a great gift to those in need.

You are an ANGEL!!!!!!!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
  Hi my name is India Sposato. I am the club president of the Unatti Club of Agoura High. I help lead a  few charitable organizations that have helped further lives. When I met Stephanie Waisler, the head of the Unatti Foundation, and visited the home I knew that this was an opportunity that was extremely important. I immediately wanted to help raise money for this foundation. This Spring I am going back to the home. I want to bring the girls money and hope, so they are inspired to strive for their dreams.
This home raises 21 girls, ages 4 to 19 years old. Unatti is soon taking in 4 more girls. Unlike the abusive situations these girls once lived in, this home creates a long-term, loving family. They are provided with a safe and supportive environment to eat, sleep, learn, play and
live. 

One of the main things that attracted me to this foundation is that the girls are given an incredible chance to get an education. Nepal is a male dominated world, and educating these girls while taking them out of poverty is the next step to fixing issues this country has. 

While I was at Unatti the girls got
in a line and told us their aspirations.
My aspiration is to be a cardiovascular
doctor.
My aspiration is to be a pilot.
My aspiration is to be a nurse.
My aspiration is to be an air hostess.
This foundation provides a great home
for these girls. We need to help these girls acheive their dreams and they need money to be educated.
The Unatti Home also has an Arts and Music Center, where the homeless children of 
Bhaktapur, Nepal are able to have a creative outlet. 
Children who are trapped in the cycle of extreme
poverty and limited opportunity nevertheless are encouraged to express
themselves honestly, fearlessly, and happily, incorporating both local and
Western artistic approaches and traditions. 
In addition the Foundation provides jobs and 
free English and Nepali literacy classes to
adult women living in Bhaktapur.

The Unatti Foundation lifts up the community through education. It uses this powerful tool to help a poverty stricken community. story:
Jawad and Sophia khan came to this community in 2007 and quickly became part of Al-Huda family.


The whole community is still in shock by Sophia Khan's sudden death, and would like to remember her thru various projects at Al-Huda Foundation.  Inshallah, these projects will be a source of continuous hasanat (rewards) for her.

  • Baby sitting area, which as a mother of two young children, she would have appreciated.
  • Revamping the sound system.

We would like both of these projects to be completed before the month of Ramadan. It will reap the maximum benefit inshaAllah by improving the sound quality and baby sitting facilty and would enhance the overall experience for the musalleens at Al-Huda.

 
If you would like to write a check then please send directly to Al-Huda Foundation at

12201 Lantern Road
Fishers, IN 46038

*Please write Sophia Khan Fund in the memo*

 

Please visit our website at http://alhudafoundation.org

story:
Short Summary

Every year countless undocumented students continue their higher education. Some are privileged to live in states that offer in-state tuition rates or even financial aid to attend college, others have none of that available. Regardless, it is a great challenge to receive a higher education while living undocumented in America. 

For this reason the Orange County Dream Team fundraises every year to provide scholarships to undocumented students. Last year OCDT awarded $5000 to undocumented students: eight $500 scholarships to continuing college students, and five $200 scholarships to graduating students. This year we hope to match last year's efforts and continue helping students continue their education as much as we can.

What We Need & What You Get

With a donation you can help make the difference for a student out there. This year we are turning online to complement our usual fundraising efforts.

There are of course some neat rewards for your contributions: 

For $5 you will receive a shout out on our Facebook page and website.

For a $25 Donation you will receive a shout out on our Facebook page and website, and a photo of Orange County Dream Team members in action, advocating for immigrant families.

For a $50 Donation you will receive a shout out on our Facebook page and website, a photo of Orange County Dream Team members in action, and an OCDT Tote Bag.

For a $100 Donation you will receive a shout out on our Facebook page and website, a photo of Orange County Dream Team members in action, and one of our infamous OCDT T-Shirt. 

The Impact

Every little bit helps. Not having to worry about a book here or an unit there can make the difference between having to take on another job or having that extra time to study for an undocumented student out there. 

This indiegogo campaign will work in conjunction with our typical fundraising efforts, and we will continue doing our best to provide some financial support. Our scholarship application will open early next year, and will be open to students nationwide.The number of scholarships awarded will depend on how much we are able to fund raise. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a contribution at this time, please share the link with your friends and family. 

Most of all, keep advocating for the human rights of immigrants everywhere!

story:
About Me & My Goal

My name is Allison White and I am currently a soon to be graduate of Valdosta State University. After many years of believing that a Fine Arts degree was what I wanted, I couldn't have been more wrong. In my last year here at Valdosta State, it has become more clear than ever, that coaching at my local CrossFit gym and competing in the Reebok CrossFit games is what I truly want to do.
Graduating with an art degree is going to be tough enough. With the certification I will be able to begin to submerge myself in training mentally and physically. I will also be able to Coach others on the sport with effective movement, fitness and nutrition. This is the key I need to open my door of opportunity.

What is Needed

The fancy price tag on this certification is $1000. All proceeds will go towards this goal. If the goal is not reached by the deadline, the proceeds will be frozen until the next date for the certification is available, however this may not be for another year. (the extra $70 is the cut the website will take out)

I am constantly striving for progress and even pennies make progress!!

The Impact

When I came to college my plan was to get in, get out, and get a degree. However the timing of me being away at college and some particular life events that happened weren't really in my plan of just being able to get in and get out. My father passed away, my grades were plummeting, the depression, anxiety, and my completely unstable past were catching up to me all at once. I hit rock bottom, and I hit it hard. I lost hope, and confidence in myself and had literally given up on everything at that point.

When I was finally able to confront myself in the mirror, I knew something had to change. I reorganized priorities in my life and made my health number one. Soon after, I had a family member introduce me to CrossFit, and the rest is history.
I've been doing CrossFit for two years now and have been the healthiest, mentally and physically I have every been in my life. My goals and outlook on life have changed tremendously since my meltdown and CrossFit has given me a reason to pursue what makes me happy.

I can say without a doubt in my mind, that rock bottom was the best thing that ever happened to me.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate and still want to help please share my story with friends and family! I've only got a few weeks to try and hit my goal before the deadline is over.

story:
I need YOU to help me achieve my dream.

I have been interested in Game Dev and Design since I was just a little kid. I learned to read playing titles like Banjo Kazooie and Donkey Kong 64. I spent every minute I could playing every game I could get my hands on. Growing up, I never had a lot of money to throw around for video games, and I believe I've beaten most of the games I do own around 10 times each. As I grew older, I began to see different pieces of gameplay that made them unique, or challenging, or interesting, or addictive. I was repeatedly told by my mother and teachers "stop playing games, they'll get you nowhere in life. I want you to help me prove them wrong.

The discovery of Full Sail University was one of the best things to happen to me. I still have around 3 or 4 of the tour booklets as I kept asking them to send me information. Full Sail is a driven, direct program that gives you exactly the information you need and provides you with the tools to make your way in the game industry without all the added baggage of traditional college. It's also quite a bit cheaper than traditional college. Unfortunately, even with Government aid and whatever money I can scrape together working minimum wage jobs isn't going to be enough. If I can get together enough money, maybe not even my full goal, I will be able to get my education and move forward in my life. One can only work in Fast Food for so long before you realize it's time to move on up.

 

Where your money will go, and what you'll get for it.

100% of the money raised here will go towards my tuition and living expenses at Full Sail University. Tuition runs 15,000 a semester, for 5 semesters total to get a bachelors degree. If I go without stopping (they run all summer) I can get my degree in around 2 years. Full Sail has an 80% hiring rate immediately upon graduating, with programs to improve your chances, so I will be working in the game industry in less than 3 years from now.

This means anyone who gets my perks will be able to have an inside man in the gaming industry, someone who will certainly try his best to give you all sorts of delightful information.

Plus, come on, who doesn't want a wish of good fortune?

 

The Hard Truth

If I'm honest, without the money this campaign could raise, chances are I'm not going to college. I'm not in a place financially to fund myself and no bank will take me due to my family's unsavory credit history and unfortunate circumstances.

Any amount of money will help me reach my goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make an investment, perhaps you could tell a friend who might be interested, or maybe even just a note of encouragement in the comments would be fabulous. And thank you again for anything!

story: According to the study, “Child Poverty in Latin America and the Caribbean,” produced by ECLAC and UNICEF in 2010, almost 45 per cent of the population under the age of 18 years is living in poverty in the region. Many of these children are left to go to school without the benefit of a proper breakfast or nutritional snack throughout the day. Your support will see that 120 children will receive a 473 ml bottle of 100% pure orange juice free of charge each day for a full school year.
