Africa to help provide a computer lab and computer education to the
students attending the International Bible College of Zambia.  These
students have had LIMITED or NO exposure to computer training
throughout their life. Through a computer lab and on-going training, the
project will help them become computer proficient - a vital skill needed
for success in today's technology-driven society. This will help position them
for success and start to impact generations to come. 
What is the
issue, problem, or challenge? 
This
project will help start to eradicate the problem of computer illiteracy.
Through the computers and provided training, the beneficiaries will learn
how to use a computer extensively, opening them up to new employment and
business opportunities. This training will help bridge the Digital Divide
and the opportunity gap. The educational training will help release their
potential and abilities. 
How will
this project solve this problem? 
Funds
will be used to purchase computers and provide on-going training. This
project will provide direct access to computers for use by the students of
the college. Access to the computers and training will transform their
lives and give them to skills to obtain a better job. 
Potential
Long Term Impact 
This training will transform the lives of participants as it
will broaden their options and help expose them to new employment and
business opportunities. The beneficiaries will become computer literate
and proficient - and consequently viable and competitive in the
market place. This will help them become independent, self-sufficient
and develop their careers. 
Other Ways
You Can Help
As you know,
every dollar counts!   But if you can't help us with a donation at this
time, we ask that you please help us get the word out! Share
our campaign with family members, friends, and coworkers.  Thank you!!!

story:
The Breaks'

Education will benefit from hip-hop music in the following ways: Hip-hop culture is engaging through music and the elements. Hip-hop teaches a variety of subject matter through its music. Hip-hop is currently utilized in both educational and even therapeutic settings. Hip-hop is a versatile form of creative expression. We have personally witnessed the power of hip-hop in educational settings. Hip-hop teaches people about life, is a motivator to learn, and is an advocate of seeking knowledge.

  • Creatrix Institute and KMVT ( http://www.kmvt15.org/ ) are working together to bridge hip-hop culture and organizations interested in transformational leadership through innovative programming. Our team has been utilizing hip-hop culture in educational settings for over 4 years in the Silicon Valley. We will provide specialized curricula, which includes technology integration to teach 21st century skills and connect our students with the Common Core standards in a hip-hop based setting. Our goal is to raise $5,000 (more is welcome and will expand our efforts) for technology and educational supplies that will provide the youth with a distinctive experience that benefits youth and families. We will be providing the youth with 14-16 weeks of programming (specialized curriculum), including music and video production. 

  • My name is Anthony, I am an educator, life entrepreneur, and family man. I am Hip-hop and the founder of Creatrix Institute. For the past 14 years I have been studying, researching, and creating hip-hop music. Upon entry into college I realized that education can be an amazing process and hope to contribute to the development of youth leadership. I continue to work within the field of hip-hop based education and hope to contribute to the way we think about hip-hop culture.

  • Our Partners include:

    Richard Gali in affiliation with Adobe Youth Voices will provide teaching and training on video production through a hip-hop music lens. Richard will provide an integrative model for expanding on the creative and experiential process the students will come to know. Richard currently works with the Boys and Girls Club of the Peninsula where hip-hop flourishes with the local youth engaged in their programming.

    Ray Romero is a local producer and educator in the Silicon Valley. Ray has been a part of the programming since it began in 2009. A wizard of production, Ray brings many talents to the classroom including passion and integrity. Ray knows about several platforms of production including Pro Tools and innovative tools for app based production. 

  • Through your contributions we will provide families with a unique opportunity to develop skills and teach a new way of being in relationship with hip-hop culture. We will give a foundational understanding of leadership and read contemporary hip-hop literature. Your contributions will provide an experience for students to record in a music studio adapting what they learn and offer their knowledge back to the community. With our partners we will expand their learning from writing to video production; from beats to reading comprehension; and from common core to experience.

Ask yourself:

What can hip-hop do for our society and what can it do for our youth?

The Impact of Hip-hop

Hip-hop based education is a researched and developed subject. Multiple institutions across the country teach, research, and contribute to hip-hop including Stanford, Harvard, CAL, UCLA, and UC Davis:

  • Creatrix Institute has carefully developed hip-hop based education in the variety of areas that are needed to give the student an understanding of hip-hop culture, philosophy, and music while enhancing listening, reading, and writing skills. The intention is to provide each student with a voice of expression, while targeting leadership, entrepreneurial spirit, and educational motivations. Other organizations have already adapted hip-hop based practices to impact in other areas such as Beats, Rhymes, and Life Inc. in Oakland (therapeutic /mental health/community development); ISEEED Inc, (community development/research); and Hip-hop For Change in San Francisco (art education/community social justice). Hip-hop based education is clearly defined and outlined with practices and developed curriculum in Schooling Hip-hop: Expanding Hip-hop Based Education Across the Curriculum, by Marc Lamont Hill & Emery Petchauer. Hip-hop research is currently a flourishing subject and as we learn more about what hip-hop does we can apply it to our systems
  • Since 2009, multiple cohorts of students have experienced hip-hop based education through Creatrix Institute and now we wish to share our current understanding of how specialized curriculum and partnerships can take our programming to the next level for youth to discover how the common core  supports innovative education. We have worked successfully with Citizen Schools a National Non-Profit and regional school districts. We have produced multiple album projects, including our colleague in Los Angeles School District. 
  • Students automatically gravitate to hip-hop culture and the ideas spread through radio waves are not the only perspective of hip-hop that exist.

What We Need and Your Impact

  • Through all levels of contribution it give youth an opportunity for an innovative educational experience. At higher levels of contribution you will be a direct part of the dialogue and meet the students and families you supported during a community showcase.
  • The funds will be directed towards items listed. We will focus first on student supplies and books. "If we don't reach our goal, we will still pursue out program to the best of our abilities.

Mic check 1, 2:

  • 1: Two Books each student (20 youth) will receive and read during the course of 12 weeks. The first is The Tao of Wu by RZA by which students will learn about philosophy within hip-hop culture and the important historical context of the rise of WU Tang, one of hip-hop’s major entrepreneurial legacies. The second reading is How to Rap: The Art and Science of the Hip-Hop MC by Paul Edwards, which will provide a solid framework to variety of aspects to emceeing (rapping) as an art form with ways that affect the human biology.

    2: 20 Composition Notebooks, 20 binders, 20 pens and pencils (medium quality and fine tip <.07mm), 300 count of recordable CD media.

    3: One high fidelity 2.1 sound system, to provide a realistic experience of how music not only disseminates information, but also provides an accurate representation of musical expression.

    4: One HD projector to utilize within the class and view numerous visual media to assist in learning and dialogue about the material. Provides a realistic experience of future educational experiences in higher education and current educational trends to increase visual media within curricula.

    5: One Macbook Pro for technology consistency and consistent presentations that occur each class/meeting. Provides reliable computing power and integrates into both music and video production needs for the program .

UP the Hill, Challenges

We will be exposing the students to a variety of hip-hop artists, perspectives, and ways of artistry. Caregivers, educators, and community members may have trouble trusting our particular choices of music and visual media, yet our program is solid in making sure our students benefit from our selections by increasing critical thinking skills and analysis levels.

  • How we will address the challenges:
  • Provide workshops for the caregivers at regular intervals for to have a space for discussion and learn about our practices.

  •  We utilize a system developed specifically to meet the needs of students struggling in educational settings and have evolved it to be all-inclusive across diverse demographics.

  • Keep up with current practices outlines in Schooling Hip-hop.

    We have worked with several cohorts of youth over the last 4 years in the Silicon Valley area and Los Angeles. Hip-hop is a consistent form of education.

    http://www.creatrixinstitute.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute, but you can help:

  • Even if you cannot contribute with presidents on paper, you can help by spreading the word within your networks. One thing I know is networks are important. I am limited in who I know, but we all share a connection to share something so important to education and to youth!!!
  • I am new to indiegogo, so help me spread the work within and with the tools we all have access to, please!

Help us envision the future for our community and bring hip-hop based education to as many youth as possible.

story:
Welcome to Purple Owl©

I, along with my business partner are developing a website to help college students succeed by making learning and studying easier for them.  As a college student myself I know the importance of studying to succeed and excel in college.  I have loved learning and education since I was very young. Furthering my education through a college degree is extremely important to me. I am a bio-medical major at The University of North Florida. I constantly see students struggling to study with difficult course material. It is my dream to be able to help my fellow college students and all future college students. I need your contributions to help fund my website so that together we can give college students a better chance to succeed and enjoy college more. My site Purple Owl offers students features that no other site can compete with.  As a college student working with a professor we know exactly what students want and need. Purple Owl includes features such as..

  • Virtual Study Groups

We have created a revolutionary system for students to have the ability to have group study sessions online. Students are extremely busy these days. Most take at least 12 credit hours a semester, are involved in clubs, and work 20+ hours a week. Purple Owl will give these students an opportunity to be able to interact with each other no matter how busy their schedules are. With some students getting off work at 12am or later the last thing the want to do is go to the library and study. Now they will be able to go home, slip on pajamas and create a virtual study group that has all of the same benefits as a face to face study group.

  • Access To Students Specific To Your Class
With most classes being so large it is hard to meet other students that you can study with. Who knows, the genius of the class might be well on the other side of the room and you will never have access to them. With Purple Owl you will be connected to everyone in your specific class. When you log on you will immediately be joined with everyone in your Biology class, for example. With everyone studying the same material it's a great opportunity to interact and study with other students.
  • Virtual Note Cards

The power to create your own note cards that you can share with other students or keep private. You can access them from your computer and most importantly your phone! No one wants to take a stack of bulky note cards everywhere they go. With virtual note cards you can access them anywhere and anytime. Imagine sitting in the doctor's office waiting with nothing to do except wait. With virtual note cards you can study and prepare.

  • Online Event Planner
With so many activities and events happening at the college, it can be hard to keep track of all the details. Purple Owl offers the easiest way to plan, organize, set up, or store event data.  Purple Owl offers you the advantage of having instant access to everyone in your university as opposed to flyers, ads, banners, etc. When a student uses the event planner they know their message will be delivered to each person individually.


We need your donations to help make a difference in improving the college learning experience for students. Together we can help students succeed!


Help make this a possibility for all college students.



  • Where Do Your Funds Go?

Unfortunately building a website costs a lot of money and marketing the site cost nearly as much.

Your funds will go towards -

  1. Building the website
  2. Marketing the website
  • What Happens If We Don't Raise All Of The Money?
Although we hope to raise all of the money but if we do not succeed the money will be put into a saving account where it will wait until the rest of the money is funded through different means so that we can move forward and put our site into action.


  • What Qualifies Us?
  1. As a college student myself I know exactly what they students want.
  2. As a professor I know what can make a student succeed or fail.
  3. We have done over a years worth of research and planning.
  4. There is no obstacle that we can not overcome.
  5. We have asked hundreds of students what they want in a website.
  6. Being involved in a college atmosphere for years have given us more than enough insight into how students either succeed or fail.
  • What Are the Risks?
  1. The site could not catch on because students don't use it.
If that happens then we will go back to the drawing board and see how we can tweak the site to make it something that all students will love

  • What Can I Do To Help If I Can't Fund?
Not everyone has the means to fund projects. Please spread the word about our campaign through social media and your friends and family. We greatly appreciate you taking the time to read about our campaign.

story:
Short Summary

The PTA at Noble Elementary in Cleveland Heights has been working on upgrading their playground for over 10 years. After all this time, the hard work of dedicated parents, teachers and administrators has culminated in a plan and a budget that can work to begin construction on the updated outdoor space as early as this fall. We have a blueprint and commitment from the District to help us install the playground this year. 

  • Most of the funds needed for the Play Structure, Tilted Sky Runner and Track Ride have been secured. We only need to raise an additional $400 to meet the budget.
  • If we are able to raise additional funds beyond the $400, we can purchase the Rock N' Cross, and additional benches and trees.
  • Every little bit helps. Please give what you can now to make our dream become a reality for our kids.

What We Need & What You Get

$400 gets us to budget to install the playground as pictured, without the Rock N' Cross. UPDATE: we made it in less than 24 hours! THANK YOU! Can we meet a new goal of $2550?

$2550 gets us another piece of equipment: The Xcelerator. (http://www.gametime.com/product/GT-Xcelerator-26077/)

$2600-$7000 adds trees and benches and the Xcelerator.

$7900 adds the above plus the Rock N' Cross.

The first 53 donations of $50 or more are eligible to engrave a brick to be installed in the new playground. Those who previously purchased bricks already have one reserved, but are welcome to reserve another.

For $1500 we can personalize a bench on the playground. This option is great for foundations or businesses. Spread the word!

    The Impact

    We believe an updated and upgraded playground will be beneficial not only to the current students of Noble Elementary, but future classes and children in the neighborhood.

      Risks & Challenges

      At this stage of the game, there really aren't any risks. We are so close to our budget goal that we just need a little help to get the project started. If we can surpass our goal and raise an extra $7600, we can take the project from great to INCREDIBLE.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Any dollar amount will help us reach our goal. You can also help by sharing this campaign with others. Post about it on Facebook, tweet to your followers, share with your favorite charitable organization. Then, come play with us when the construction is complete!

story:
Please enjoy this video enola's friend Gameli made.  enola is asked for nutrition advice constantly and sometimes she cries about how she doesn't know the answer, but other times she gives bad advice and it's really detrimental.  Your donation to enola's college fund will go towards stopping these tragedies.


More About enola and Her Nutrition School Dream:

"I am a 29-year-old chronically homeless disabled woman and I am trying to fund myself into and through nutrition school. The school I want to go to is called Bauman College and the nutrition consultant program tuition is $10,149.95 if I can pay for it in full. I am trying to find grants and scholarships for the first time in my life and it's been discouraging!  I'm having a hard time because Bauman is a private institution.  So I thought I would reach out through crowd-funding.

I grew up below the poverty line, raised by parents who were working hard to make ends meet and doing their best to raise two children. Although they were doing their best, the environment I grew up in was long-term damaging to me. I have PTSD and other complimentary mental health disorders and have done a lot of work to heal from my past as well as give support to others who are going through or have gone through traumas or breakdowns. 

No one in my family has gone to college and I was not very interested in changing that until recently. I have taken a few classes at community college over the past few years, but that was more out of curiosity than out of interest to pursue a degree or career. But when I got on SSI/SSDI (disability) in 2011, I learned how having a little bit of money could open up time for me to spend on healing my self. 

And now, as I get older and am still homeless, disabled and impoverished, I can see the benefits of becoming an expert at something I am passionate about and using my skills symbiotically with those who can benefit from them. And this is what I intend to do, because, although I am happy and have come to know deep friendship and love, I believe I deserve a better life than I have known thus far and I understand how financial gain will add new branches to my personal path.  Like maybe I could live in a house or something, somewhere with running water.

It's one of my goals, upon completion of the Nutrition Consultant course at Bauman, to offer no/low-fee sliding scale services to those in need. It is my experience as a person in need, and the experience I've heard about from my peers, that those who could benefit the most from specialized care hardly have the means to seek and secure that care for themselves.

Bauman's Nutrition Consultant program is perfect for me because I have struggled with chronic pain and fatigue as well as mental health disorders and eating disorders for possibly my whole life. They are all interwoven and stem from the early traumas and I believe that all healing can be found in the ways in which we take care of our bodies.  The foods we eat are essentially linked to all aspects of our health. Bauman's program is holistic and will help me understand this intrinsically felt truth more. I have spent many years navigating my own health, eliminating and introducing new things to try to figure out how to quell migraines, candidiasis, PTSD flashbacks, mania, depression, and all sorts of other things. I have gotten to some places in this exploration that I never thought imaginable and I know there are more places I've yet to find. My interest in nutrition begins inside my own body and echoes outward towards those of others. I want to learn, and I want to be certified to teach. I want to heal myself and heal others."

Other Things enola Does/Off-Topic Perks:

enola dismay is best(/not very) known for the personal zine she puts out, called "No Gods No Mattress."  

"no gods no mattress is about whatever i feel like.  it often includes things about navigating roads inside of my own brain and body, as well as the more traditional kind.  travel, trauma, illness, wellness, magick, support, sadness.  people tell me they like it, maybe i'm not describing it well enough."

Issue 22 is 130 pages long!  That's basically a novel.  She'll send you one if you donate some money and want one.  She also makes patches and jewelry and whatever else she feels like.  She likes giving gifts.  Nothing she makes is online, sorry.

She doesn't like how one has to donate a certain amount to get something in return.  Please just give whatever you can.  You can email any questions about the campaign or requests for stuff in return to her at: xgaylordqueerx@gmail.com.


Enola is basically not online!

Are you?  Will you please help spread the word about this campaign?  Please post anywhere you want!  It would be so appreciated!
story_txt:
Please enjoy this video enola's friend Gameli made.  enola is asked for nutrition advice constantly and sometimes she cries about how she doesn't know the answer, but other times she gives bad advice and it's really detrimental.  Your donation to enola's college fund will go towards stopping these tragedies.

More About enola and Her Nutrition School Dream:
"I am a 29-year-old
chronically homeless disabled woman and I am trying to fund myself
into and through nutrition school.  The school I want to go to is
called Bauman College and the nutrition consultant program tuition is $10,149.95 if I can pay for it in full.  I am trying to find grants and scholarships for the first time in my life and it's been discouraging!  I'm having
a hard time because Bauman is a private institution.  So I thought I would reach out through crowd-funding.

I grew up below the
poverty line, raised by parents who were working hard to make ends meet and
doing their best to raise two children.  Although they were doing
their best, the environment I grew up in was long-term damaging to me.  I have PTSD and other complimentary mental
health disorders and have done a lot of work to heal from my past as
well as give support to others who are going through or have gone
through traumas or breakdowns. 


No one in my family has gone to college and I was not very interested in changing that
until recently.  I have taken a few classes at community college over
the past few years, but that was more out of curiosity than out of
interest to pursue a degree or career. But when I got on SSI/SSDI (disability) in
2011, I learned how having a little bit of money could open up time
for me to spend on healing my self. 
And now, as I get
older and am still homeless, disabled and impoverished, I can see the
benefits of becoming an expert at something I am passionate about and
using my skills symbiotically with those who can benefit from them. 
And this is what I intend to do, because, although I am happy and have
come to know  deep friendship and love, I believe I deserve a better
life than I have known thus far and I understand how financial gain
will add new branches to my personal path.  Like maybe I could live in a house or something, somewhere with running water.




It's one of my
goals, upon completion of the Nutrition Consultant course at Bauman,
to offer no/low-fee sliding scale services to those in need.  It is my
experience as a person in need, and the experience I've heard about

themselves.

chronic pain and fatigue as well as mental health disorders and
eating disorders for possibly my whole life.  They are all interwoven
and stem from the early traumas and I believe that all
healing can be found in the ways in which we take care of our
bodies.  The foods we eat are essentially linked to all aspects of
our health.  Bauman's program is holistic and will help me understand
this intrinsically felt truth more.  I have spent many years navigating
my own health, eliminating and introducing new things to try to
figure out how to quell migraines, candidiasis, PTSD flashbacks, mania, depression, and
all sorts of other things.  I have gotten to some places in this
exploration that I never thought imaginable and I know there are more
places I've yet to find.  My interest in nutrition begins inside my
own body and echoes outward towards those of others.  I want to
learn, and I want to be certified to teach.  I want to heal myself and heal
others."

Other Things enola Does/Off-Topic Perks:

"no gods no mattress is about whatever i feel like.  it often includes things about navigating roads inside of my own brain and body, as well as the more traditional kind.  travel, trauma, illness, wellness, magick, support, sadness.  people tell me they like it, maybe i'm not describing it well enough."

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I am Bishisht Bhatta, a computer engineering student from Nepal.

Well, these days I am in Achham, one of the remote area of Nepal. Here, I am doing volunteer teaching in a government school. I teach students Science & Computer. 

Here we don't have proper toilets.


What We Need & What You Get

What We Need=?

For building 4 toilets, 2 for females and 2 for males, we need US $ 2,000 . I am donating US$ 500, as I don't have more than that these days.

What You Get=?

We are organizing trek to Ramarosan area after 3 months.

Here are some pictures of that area. 



And donors are welcome to visit. We will provide you free home-stay with locals.


So, what if we don't reach our goal?
Well, first of all we believe we will reach the goal. But, in case we failed, we have to reduce the number of toilets to be constructed.



The Impact

Well the money you donate will help 600+ students to get clean toilets. Students belong to families who never have been to toilets.


Risks & Challenges

The main problem here is we have to travel to 500+ KM to bring materials for building. For that I am going to seek help from my friend who have a pick up truck. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate please tell your 2 friends about this. 

Thank you very much.

story:
St. Stephens Comprehensive secondary school is located in Manfwe district, Uganda. It is the only secondary school in the area and services over 30 primary schools.There are a total of 742 students at St. Stephens and they all currently share one latrine, a latrine that is quickly filling.

The amount of human waste in the current latrine will have it reach its capacity shortly, leaving the students nowhere to go. The only solution the school currently has is to dig another latrine when it fills.Our goal is to alleviate the need to build latrine after latrine by constructing a latrine that can be emptied by truck when filled.

This type of latrine allows for increased sanitation. Providing a sanitary latrine will alleviate sickness in the school and help children remain in school.Remaining in school allows for a brighter future here in Uganda.Your support is so appreciated. If you can help with $10, $20 or $50 – 742 students will be truly grateful!

Please support us in helping these talented children. It's an honor to live with them and help them. Please help us provide a more sanitary atmosphere. Your gift is tru ly appreciated.

What We Need

    These funds will help build the much needed latrine at St. Stephens Secondary School. The school and local community are contributing labor and expertise in the building of the latrine, as well as additional supplies. Involving the community has produced a sense of ownership and care for the project. However, this poor community has given all they can and are asking for your help!

    If we do not reach the full goal we will begin building the latrine but will have to eliminate finishes such as doors and waterproof paint pivotal to privacy and sanitation. Please help us reach our goal!

      The Impact

      742 students at St. Stephens Comprehensive Secondary School are currently using one latrine. The current latrine is close to filling, which will leave the students and staff no where to go.

      This latrine project is specifically designed to be sustainable by allowing for a truck to come in and empty the latrine. Other pit latrines are designed to fill and the seal, this latrine would alleviate the need to pit latrine after latrine and provide a more sanitary solution.

      This latrine also allows for further privacy for young girls. In Uganda it is an unfortunate common occurrence that girls will not attend school during their menstrual cycle due to lack of facilities and privacy. These absences often lead to poor testing, and eventually leads to dropping out. This latrine would provide the girls their own space and sanitation and allow for them to continue their education.

      Risks & Challenges

      If we do not raise the necessary funds we will be unable to complete the latrine project. The reality if this project depends on you!

      The community and the school are contributing all they can to the project by providing half the bricks, and all of the river sand, ordinary cement, iron sheets, hoop iron, ventilators, and a discounted price on the doors. The other supplies required will allow for a sanitary and safe latrine.

      Other Ways You Can Help St. Stephens

      If you cannot donate at this time please share this with your friends! Or donate throughout the year at www.help-international.org Go visit our new facebook page for St. Stephens at www.facebook.com/ststephenscomprehensive

story:
Short Summary

The Avalon Academy (www.theavalonacademy.org) is a special school for children and young adults who are severely physically disabled. Most of our students depend on wheelchairs because they have a condition called cerebral palsy, a form of brain damage which impairs movement and posture.

Currently our students rely on public transportation for community outings. Public buses are time-consuming and inefficient as they can only accommodate two people in wheelchairs at one time. They are also unreliable so trips need to be cancelled if the weather is unfavorable. We have to rely on parent volunteers for trips with more than two students or if destinations aren’t convenient for public transportation.

The students love being out in the community. Typical activities include:

·  Educational visits to local museums

·  Volunteering at the local SPCA

·  Running errands to stores, farmers market, and the post office

·  Social events at local coffee shops

·  Swimming

·  Seasonal trips eg pumpkin patch, ice-skating

Avalon has struggled with issues surrounding public transportation for students for the last ten years. Our students need a better solution. They should have access to the greater community just like all school aged students. Please help us expand the horizons and brighten up the lives of these very deserving young people.

What We Need

$60,000 would buy a 2015 RAM ProMaster 2500 with a high roof, long wheelbase, and Mobility Package. The Mobility Package includes a side or rear ADA lift plus SmartFloor technology which provides moveable seating and layouts that can be readily changed to accommodate different numbers of wheelchairs.

What An Adapted Van Will Allow Us To Do

All of our students depend on wheelchairs to access their world. A wheelchair-accessible van will allow more students more access to more places. We will no longer be limited by the constraints of public transport. An adapted van will enable us to:

·  Visit places not easily accessible by public transport

·  Visit a variety of far off destinations as transportation will be less time-consuming

·  Go on trips when parents aren’t able to volunteer

·  Travel when the weather isn’t good

·  Travel as a school community in a larger group

What You Get

$20 donation: "Thank You" card

$50 donation:   Avalon awareness pin

$100 donation:   Avalon wrist band

$250 donation:   Avalon car magnet

$500 donation:   Framable Avalon artwork

$1,000 donation:   Avalon artwork + T-Shirt

$2,500 donation:   donor’s name recognized on one bus seat

$5,000 donation:   donor's name recognized on the bus

The Impact

A dedicated van that has been adapted for students in wheelchairs will open up a wealth of possibilities for a group of young people for whom access to the community is extremely difficult. Easier access to the local community also increases the visibility of our students who are coping with severe challenges, thereby promoting greater acceptance and integration into society.

About Our School

The Avalon Academy is an innovative model school for children and young adults aged 5-22 years with severe physical disabilities caused by cerebral palsy. We have a unique emphasis on integrating movement education into all aspects of the school curriculum. The school opened in 2005 and is located in Burlingame, California and serves students from throughout the Bay Area. We are accredited by the California Department of Education.

Avalon currently serves 16 students. In addition to physical disabilities, all students also experience other complications associated with cerebral palsy. Students are non-verbal and rely on specialized devices to communicate. Many students have feeding difficulties and several must be tube-fed. All students have some degree of cognitive impairment and about half experience seizures. Vision impairment is also common.

Avalon prides itself on the quality of education and services it provides for students with very significant needs.  In addition to 4 highly qualified special education teachers, we employ physical therapists, speech and language pathologists, and a teacher for the visually impaired. A team of dedicated instructional assistants ensure that the student: staff ratio is close to 1:1. Avalon is a happy, innovative, respectful, and enriching community.

About Cerebral Palsy

Cerebral palsy (CP) is the term used for a group of non-progressive disorders of movement and posture caused by abnormal development of, or damage to, motor control centers of the brain. CP is caused by events that affect the developing brain before, during, or after birth. Examples of risk factors for CP include premature birth, asphyxia during birth, and meningitis during early childhood.

The abnormalities of muscle control that define CP are often accompanied by other disorders caused by more extensive damage to the developing brain. These include cognitive impairment, communication disorders, feeding problems, seizures, and vision impairment.

Approximately 500,000 children and adults in the United States have CP, and it is newly diagnosed in about 6,000 infants and young children each year.

How Cerebral Palsy Affects Our Students’ Lives

Avalon specializes in the education and well-being of young people with the most challenging disabilities caused by CP. Our students are dependent on family, friends, and caregivers for all aspects of their lives. All of the students at Avalon need assistance with mobility as they are dependent on wheelchairs. Some students require assistance while utilizing other equipment such as walkers. Our students are non-verbal and use specialized programmable devices to communicate, often via a head-switch if arm control is affected. Eating and drinking is challenging for our students with some relying on tube-feeding.

Our students are remarkably resilient and remain happy and sociable in spite of the many challenges that life has thrown at them.

Please Share our Story

We cannot do this alone, it needs to be a community effort. Please share our story with your friends and contacts.

The Avalon Academy is a 501(c)3 organization. All donations are tax deductible to the maximum extent allowable by law.

In addition to donating through the button above, checks can be addressed to The Avalon Academy and mailed to:

The Avalon Academy, 818 Mahler Road, Burlingame, CA 94010

For further details about this project, please contact Kinga Czegeni kinga@theavalonacademy.org or Samuele Palazzi samuele@theavalonacademy.org

story:
QUAD was founded when Kate, Cate, and Andreas competed together and won the Kogod School of Business Case Competition last February. We are a team of graduate students from American University in Washington DC who have been accepted into the prestigious UN Designing for Social Innovation & Leadership program. 

We study different things - law, business, and social enterprise - but we share passions of design thinking, sustainability, and leadership. This opportunity falls perfectly in line with our passions. 

The program costs $3000 per student and flights cost approximately $1500, bringing our fundraising total to $13,500. We have maxed out our student loans and need funding before the registration deadline on August 20th. 

Together we are building a movement to design a brighter future for us all. Help us reach our goal!


FMI on the course: 
 http://www.internationalpeaceandconflict.org/forum/topics/call-for-applications-2014-designing-for-social-innovation-and#.U87nBoB_vZc

FMI on us:
Andreas - www.linkedin.com/pub/andreas-vailakis/b/8b8/651
Cate - https://www.linkedin.com/in/cbeecherj
Kate - www.linkedin.com/in/katelarge

story:
Dear Citizen of the World,

You are cordially invited to the 3rd annual Ontario LATIN ARTS Festival in Toronto, Canada, July 12-13, 2014.

2014 Ontario LATIN ARTS Festival is a two-day festival to celebrate Latin music and culture on Saturday, July 12th at Mel Lastman Square and Sunday, July 13th at the North York Civic Centre in Toronto.   There will be performances by top Latin musicians and dancers. Educational workshops will be a part of the festival’s program.  All free to the public.  

The Ontario Latin Arts Festival will highlight the heritage and culture of the Latin people of Canada.

With your help, The Ontario LATIN ARTS Festival 2014 will present two days of large-scale participatory art exhibits, workshops, music, dance and arts and crafts, made by Latin American artisans. Numerous additional events to be announced.

We invite you to join us, in body or in spirit, as we build community, establish connections, celebrate culture, and dance all night with our ancestors.

Sincerely,

The Ontario LATIN ARTS Festival 2014 Team

Produced by the Hispanic Canadian Arts and Cultural Association, a Canadian not-for-profit group. The festival is a volunteer-based social initiative; it is our vision for a more celebratory future.

 www.ontariolatinartsfestival.com

Square and Sunday, July 13th at the North York Civic Centre in Toronto.
  There will be performances by top Latin musicians and dancers. Educational
workshops will be a part of the festival’s program.  All free to the public.  
The Ontario Latin Arts Festival will
highlight the heritage and culture of the Latin people of Canada.

With your help, The
Ontario LATIN ARTS Festival 2014 will present two days of large-scale
participatory art exhibits, workshops, music, dance and arts and crafts, made by
Latin American artisans. Numerous additional events to be announced.
We invite you to join us, in body or
in spirit, as we build community, establish connections, celebrate culture, and
dance all night with our ancestors.
Sincerely,
The Ontario LATIN ARTS Festival 2014
Team
Produced by the Hispanic Canadian Arts and
Cultural Association, a Canadian not-for-profit group. The festival is a volunteer-based social initiative; it is our vision for a more
celebratory future.
 www.ontariolatinartsfestival.com

story:
LinguaeLive.ca (LiLi) is a free tool for eTandem that helps learners improve their language and cultural skills by making connections abroad. Through peer-to-peer exchange, students learn with others across the globe.

Want to know how the website works? Watch the video below.

     
Want to hear strategies on using LinguaeLive.ca in the classroom? Watch the video below.


       LinguaeLive.ca is a web platform. It efficiently and safely helps teachers and students across the globe find each other and work together. It enables effective language and culture sharing between classes.

LinguaeLive helps instructors find complementary classes abroad. Once instructors sign up, LiLi suggests potential partners according to complementary language needs and schedules. Teachers decide together whether to link their courses and work together. For example, an English instructor in Spanish-speaking Bogotá, Colombia and a Spanish instructor in English-speaking Columbus, Ohio might link their classes for the upcoming semester.

LinguaeLive automates student sign-ups and facilitates matches. Once instructors link classes, their students sign up and enter their availability. LiLi then suggests matches accordingly. Student pairs who have complementary schedules can quickly plan their communication sessions. They find it easy and fun to work together.

LinguaeLive allows students to document their session times using LiLi’s timing function. This feature makes record keeping easy. Students and their instructors can view the number of minutes that they practiced each language with their partners.

       Trust your own experience! Immersion is one of the best ways to learn a language. That’s why peer-to-peer communication is super effective. ETandem with LinguaeLive is immersive communication that safely and efficiently augments classroom teaching.  

Look at our results from from a student survey at Queen's University in Kingston.

        LinguaeLive.ca is already in use! Nearly 1300 users are signed up and about 45 eTandems are going on.
Our Big Challenge: The teachers involved in LinguaeLive work for free, but web platforms are not free and we have hit a dry spot in our grant funding. Help LiLi grow until it draws enough voluntary, sliding scale lab fees to self-power.

Right now, your financial support will help us:

  • go live with our improved version of LiLi on September 1st
  • to ensure that our mission continues to be online by funding our site's hosting and administration costs for two years
  • pay our web engineer and student workers
  • broaden our worldwide appeal by localizing our site into six languages
  • outreach to a critical mass of students so that every student can find an available peer to eTandem with
  • promote world peace, empathy, and tolerance by recognizing and humanizing other cultures
  • reach our stretch goal of producing a mobile application so that students can eTandem without being tied to a computer

In the near future, your financial support will help bring peer eTandems to:

  • people who are not in formal language courses
  • students in underprivileged schools around the world 

       -Good Deeds = Good Vibrations     
Your donation brings the satisfaction that you are helping folks around the world learn better. Peer-to-peer exchange improves language skills and cultural understanding. What could be better than that? Of course, you will also be showered with our inexpressible gratitude for your generosity. And, for certain dollar amount donations, there is some sweet LiLi swag!
 
       -Your Autograph on our Acknowledgement Wall
After sending us a JPEG image of your signature, we will post your name on LinguaeLive.ca to honour your contribution.



       -LinguaeLive.ca Buttons &Stickers-
With these cool LiLi buttons and/or stickers, you can demonstrate your support for peer-to-peer exchange! The buttons are 1 5/8" and the stickers are 2 1/4".


       -A Meet and Greet with the LinguaeLive Team-
Get a chance to talk about the project with students and professors from Queen's University. The founders, contributors, and students behind the website are eager to listen and to chat about your comments and questions concerning LinguaeLive.ca.

Risks and Challenges LinguaeLive.ca is live and it’s growing! LiLi is already helping 100s of students meet and practice every semester -- for free! 
We are working towards making LiLi self-sustaining through renewable grants and donations. 
Our short term CHALLENGE is to keep our momentum while we get there. 
Our long-term CHALLENGE is to give every learner the chance to participate! 
This means 
- keeping the platform optimized and updated. 
- making the platform more accessible. It should: 
            -be made lighter, especially for people with slower internet connection. 
            -be made more user friendly, especially for people who don’t
              use computers much. 
            -be translated into more languages, especially for monolingual users.

story:
My name is Nova Moisa and I am taking senior portraits for five students chosen by Park Rose High School's Homeless Advocate. I am asking for your help to pay for Pro Photo Supply gift cards enabling each student to print their favorite pictures.

I was shocked and saddened to learn that local high schools have the need for a full-time Homeless Advocate. By the time these kids reach high school the average student has attended eight different schools. I recently met a former student who attended fourteen different schools between kindergarden and 12th grade. 

What We Need

On Tuesday, November 18th, I took pictures for two of these students. After the pictures have been edited, each student will get a CD of their images. After meeting these students it sunk in that they will not have the funds to have any of their pictures printed. How great would it be to give each student a gift card for professional printing along with their CD? This would allow them to share wallet sizes with their friends and give larger pictures to their relatives. 

If $500 is raised, each student will get a $100 gift card which will enable them to print several of their favorites for their friends and family. Any amount less than $500 will be split equally between the five students.

These are great kids! Several of these students work during the school year to help their families. One of the students I met told me her mother has two jobs. Paying for prints on their own is simply out of their grasp. 

By donating to this cause, you are making an impact on the lives of these five students! You're letting them know that they have supporters who want them to succeed.

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize not everyone can help out financially, here are two other ways you can help:

  • share this info with your friends and family
  • be my photo assistant and hold reflectors during a shoot
Every amount helps, together we can make a difference!

story:
Video filmed and edited by Runn Shayo

Arts in the Woods 2014

July 13th to July 18th

A SUMMER ARTS CAMP FOR 

 HOMELESS LGBTQ YOUNG  ADULTS


Nestled in the rolling hills of upstate New York, Arts in The Woods is a summer arts retreat designed to empower young queer artists and build an intergenerational community of visual artists, musicians, dancers, writers and performers. From Sunday July 13th to Friday July 18th, young people ages 18-24 who have survived NYC and Boston's queer youth shelters will attend a collective arts residency at Easton Mountain Retreat Center and be nurtured by more established queer artists and performers. Arts in the Woods creates space for all participants to heal together from the misogyny, transphobia, racism, inadequate housing, and economic injustice so pervasive in our cities. The beautiful land at Easton Mountain offers artistic inspiration and a perfect backdrop for creativity.

Our goal for 2014 is to develop the creativity and leadership of 40 young people and 8 teaching artists at this summer's Arts in the Woods.  WE NEED YOUR HELP to make this incredible experience financially possible.

Workshops were made in art, theater, music, fashion, crafts, and dance movement.  Intergenerational sharing circles provided a safe and loving environment for participants to process their experiences and build community.  Help us create this Arts in the Woods 2014 by making a donation today!

We are pleased to announce the return of Greg Cassin. Greg is a powerful charismatic group leader working with at risk youth. He will be leading the group healing circles and guiding the youth campers with love and care.

                           Announcing our esteemed  2014 Senior Mentors!

   Mark Allan Davis                    Roberto Juarez                       Julie Tolentino

  Dance & Theater                    Painting & Drawing             Performance Art


Our 2014 Artist Teachers

Wil Fisher          Maia Cruz Palileo     Ethan Shoshan      Darin Chase       Freddy Freeman

   Runn Shayo             Jason Hill            Quito Zigler         Shelly Marlow        Kendal Kelly


Friends Were Made!

Dance Movement  Performance Art and Theater Music, Fashion and Creative Writing

Community was Made

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Expenses includes room and board, three meals a day, transportation, teacher's honorariums, and supplies. The cost to cover each camper is approximately $600.00  

PLEASE HELP SEND A QUEER YOUTH TO ART CAMP

DONATE NOW AND CHANGE A YOUNG PERSON'S LIFE!

     No donation is too small! Please give what you can!

                                            Checks can be mailed to: New Alternatives c/o AITW  

                                                              83 Christopher Street, New York, NY 10014 

                                                                      *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *

This year we are partnering with 

New Alternatives:  New Alternatives for LGBT Homeless Youth was created in October, 2008 by a group of volunteers and professionals with experience working with homeless LGBT youth in various shelter and transitional housing settings. The mission of the organization is to increase the self-sufficiency of homeless LGBT youth to enable them to “go beyond” the shelter system and transition into stable adult lives. We do this by providing services such as case management, education services, life skills training, community-building recreational activities, opportunities for self-expression, and support services for HIV+ youth. Our guiding principles are those of harm reduction, youth development, and empowerment.

GLASS Boston:  Boston Gay & Lesbian Adolescent Social Services opened in 1995, as New England’s first (and the country’s fourth) community center serving young people in the gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender community. An average of 25-30 youth a night come to GLASS to meet friends, talk to staff or participate in formal programming.   Boston GLASS provides counseling, advocacy and referrals for health care services and housing to Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender and Questioning (GLBTQ) teens and young adults, many of whom are youth of color.

 Sylvia's Place: MCCNY Homeless Youth Services: Sylvia’s Place is the starting point for New York City’s LGBTQI youth in crisis. Integrating case management with mental health services while stressing the unique strengths and potential of each youth, MCCNY Homeless Youth Services has developed a proven method for serving LGBTQI youth in crisis. This method has been modeled by service providers across the country and around the world.

THE ALI FORNEY CENTER  The Ali Forney Center is the largest and most comprehensive program in the nation dedicated to meeting the needs of homeless LGBTQ youth. Through our Outreach Services, Drop In Center and Emergency and Transitional Housing we see over 1,000 homeless LGBTQ youth each year. We offer three warm meals a day, showers, and clothing. We provide youth with on-site medical and mental health services, HIV and STI testing and treatment, substance abuse support, career and educational counseling and life skills mentoring. Above all, we offer these young people the tools they need to reclaim their lives and become independent.

New Alternatives are 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization.

You can also visit us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter           

for updates and exclusive promotions!

story:
ABOUT US

We are a group of 29 students from the School of Business of the University of Quebec in Montreal (ESG-UQAM). As part of our degree, we will be traveling to the Arabian Peninsula-United Arabs Emirates, Qatar and/or Oman- in May 2014 to gain practical experience in negotiation and international management.


THE INTERNATIONAL STUDIES PROJECT

It is a project entirely managed by students.

It was initiated in 1989 to offer a unique opportunity to students to deepen their knowledge and experience of foreign countries and the relations between Canada and those countries. 

This highly demanding Project has five main components:

  • a series of seminars on the selected countries;
  • the search for mandates assigned by a Quebec-based companies;
  • the organization of a colloquium on the subject;
  • the representation of the Quebec-based companies in foreign countries; and
  • the submission of a research essay on aspects of the county/institution concerned.


WHY IS THIS PROJECT WORTH FUNDING?

This program gives students the unique opportunity to:

  • apply their knowledge;
  • gain international work experience;
  • develop skills in negotiation and international management;
  • have a better understanding of the complexity of international trade;
  • make lasting cross-cultural connections; and
  • learn about new cultures, new languages and new ways of doing things.

So far, the Project has covered the following countries:

South Africa-Namibia (2013)
Southeast Asia: Malaysia – Singapore – Brunei (2011)
The Balkans Peninsula: Bulgaria – Macedonia - Serbia (2010)
United Arabs Emirates (2009
South Africa (2008)
India (2007)
Vietnam - Turkey(2006)
Italy (2005)
Brazil (2004)
Tunisia (2003)
Ireland (2001)
Vietnam (1997)
Korea – Chile (1996)
Indian Ocean: Mauritius - Madagascar (1995)
China (1994)
Vietnam - Singapore - Malaysia – Thailand – Maghreb – Mexico (1993)
Pacific Islands- United Kingdom - Czech and Slovak Federal Republic – Poland – Hungary – Scandinavia (1992)
Thailand – German – Japan (1991)
USSR (1990)
Italy – Germany (1989)


WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Each student need to raise 3000$ to cover the costs of plane fares, food and accommodation during the three week stay in the Arabian Peninsula. 

We have had several fundraisers, which can be seen on our Facebook page.

We are hugely grateful to our corporate and private sponsors for their support.

However, even with their incredible generosity, we are still in search of further funding. We are only requesting $5000 to donate approximately $160 towards each student's expenses when we travel abroad (including Indiegogo fees). These donations can make a significant impact on student fundraising efforts.

We would be more than grateful for any support you feel you are able to give.

If you don't feel you can support us financially, please do share this page with all your friends!!


HAUTE COUTURE FASHION SHOW

Our partner, CHIC Agency is holding a Fashion Show and a silent auction on March 27th  2014 : http://defile.ca/

All proceeds from this event will go to our Project.

You can buy you ticket online: http://events.studentsphere.ca/fr/event/defile-de-mode



Don't forget that you are also helping Quebec-based companies seeking to expand or reinforce their presence in the Arabian Peninsula!


With your help, this Project will give everyone involved a fantastic and unforgettable experience! Thank you!

story:
Project Summary

As a UK based charity Simply Limitless runs a Well-being Centre near Birmingham in the West Midlands region. We support the community in a variety of ways to attain better health and well-being.
Surprisingly 25% of children in the UK are living in poverty and are at risk of hunger especially during the school holidays when they no longer receive the free school meals they get when attending lessons.
Our project is simple - we aim to bridge that gap by sending volunteers into the community to provide healthy lunches to those children. But we need your help to provide that food!
In the UK today, 4 million children are living in poverty.
Make a difference. Make Lunch.

What We Need & What You Get

Every amount donated allows us to feed more kids in our area! Even if we don't reach our target we're still going ahead! But the more we raise, the more we can do!

The Impact

All this helps to bring the community together and to ensure that kids don't go hungry during their school holidays. We prepare and carry out the project using a plan developed by national charity, "Make Lunch". Projects are gaining momentum throughout the UK!

Risks & Challenges

We always work with local people and will never go into an area uninvited. Sometimes people can be wary of receiving charity in this way, but really there are no strings attached! One successful location has been at a Children Centre and this has enabled us to bring help alongside their other activities.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please help in other ways by following us on Twitter @SLimitless and help us to spread the word - thanks!!

    Support Simply Limitless to feed kids in the West Midlands.

    If you're a UK tax payer see our website for Gift Aid opportunities.


      And that's all there is to it.

story:
--- ----- UPDATE 1ST AUGUST ----- ---

As of today we have had sufficient private donations through our bank accounts to top up our total high enough to clear the debt! We are incredibly grateful to all who have contributed to the campaign and are happy to announce that through the efforts and generosity of our supporters all over the world Wilderland is now safe from the councils demands and can continue to push forward.
This doesn't mean the fundraising has to stop though. As discussed in the updates section we are going to put any excess funds generated during the remainder of the crowd funding campaign towards building our new visitor house. This is the next step in turning Wilderland into a truly world class education center and hive of sustainability. So if you believe in this goal by all means continue to donate and watch Wilderland grow and change the world.

Sustainability in Action. 

Wilderland is a charitable Trust dedicated to empowering individuals to enhance the global environment and personal health of everyone. A unique education centre where sustainable living is a reality, Wilderland offers people just like you the chance to come and learn about living in a way that will preserve the environment for future generations. 

^$


Our Current Situation

Wilderland has always managed to sustain itself financially through selling honey, produce and crafts at local markets and a modest roadside shop. However, the council has demanded that a retrospective development  fee that Wilderland has been paying off in $50 weekly installments be paid within the month. Wilderland has attempted to negotiate a feasible payment plan but the council no longer wants to communicate. They have threatened a forced sale of the land if the remaining $30000 is not paid by the end of the month. Without your help this irreplaceable learning institute may be lost forever.
//See update above//

Please donate now to ensure a sustainable future for all!

The Future of Wilderland

 Wilderland has been going through a strong re-visioning process over the last year, reassessing our intentions and perspectives and ensuring our practices are in line with the specifics set out in the trust deed. We aim to improve facilities for the volunteers who come here every day from all over the world. This will take the form of a new visitor house with integrated facilities for accommodation and workshops.

We are also always continuing to develop new ways to decrease our footprint, increase self-sufficiency and work towards creating a truly sustainable space for the benefit of all and are keen to share this knowledge with everyone.

Make a donation now to guarantee Wilderland for future generations. 

Risks & Challenges

Our greatest challenge to resolve this threat is the time frame in which we have recently been ordered to pay the remainder of this fee.
Wilderland's economic sustainability would be at jeopardy should we need to enter into a mortgage agreement with a financial institution to cover these council fees. Even so, our bank has advised that the risk to their public image is too high should they have to foreclose on a loan to Wilderland, so they are unwilling to give us a loan.

Donate now to stop the forced sale of this land.

For more information you can watch the short video on our situation or please feel free to ask any questions you may have.

Note - The council is demanding that we pay $30,203.63. We are trying to raise $32,000 in order to be able to pay this and cover costs of the fundraising campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please get the word out to your friends, networks and make some noise about our situation!

All your help and generosity is greatly appreciated.


Finally a thank you to our sponsors at Eco-store for donating some gifts for this campaign.

story: Our undocumented students are talented and determined to graduate from George Mason University to better support a future for themselves, their families and our communities.  However, many of our Mason students do not qualify for Federal Aid and rely on scholarships to make this dream come true semester by semester.  Your gift of $10, $25, $50 will contribute to a Mason DREAMers/ DREAM Project Scholarship that will help transform the lives our DREAMers!

story:
Short Summary about F2 from Viby

Hello, we are F2 from Aarhus Business College in Denmark and we are an "Innovation with Spanish" class with 25 student. Our study tour is to Miami, but it is very pricey and we don't have time enough to earn this much money.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The price per student is 1.800 $
  • This will get us to Miami for two whole weeks where we will attend an university where we will learn about the american culture and new innovation. 
  • Everything you guys donate will go to our trip and even though we dont reach our goal, this is going to help us a long way. 
  • As thank you, we will send you all a personal picture from Miami and maybe we'll start a blog where you can get updated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

story: We want to take our training in Greece, combining the yacht certificate, a sailing holiday and a honeymoon all in one. We chose Greece over Portugal as we thought that anything we can throw into the local economy can't hurt. I have also always wanted to sail the Aegean and Ionian seas. A huge thank you to all who have contributed and to all those who came to our wedding. We had just the day we wanted so thank you all for being there.

story:
Our Short Summary

Who are we? And why are we asking for your help?

Hello, my name is Creighton Jones, and I am the founder of Jones Music Media Inc. and The Young Musicians Foundation, a 501 (c)3 non-profit organization, that seeks to fund the music education of low-income children. I established this organization as a way for a myself and other musicians alike, to connect with each other and give back to the community. We provide an outlet and resource for children looking to learn music, and gain potential scholarships for music lessons or schools, and to connect with musicians in the community as a source of encouragement.

JMM Inc., was created with the hopes of giving EVERY child the means to learn music, and not just those who come from families that are financially secure. Our organization works to give these children the chance that we didn’t have, as our members also come from low-income families and couldn’t afford music lessons outside of school.  This community has given us so much, and as an organization we seek to give back to that as much as possible.

We are a community based organization, that gives back to the community that’s given us so much. As a nonprofit, our hope for success would not be possible without you. We now ask that you help us give back to those that were like us, and didn’t have a chance, or an opportunity to expand their education.

What We Need

JMM Inc., with your help, is seeking to raise $10,000. Half of this amount will go directly into The Young Musicians Foundation to cover the costs of scholarships and music lessons through the end of the year. The remainder will help pay for the facility, utilities, and office supplies. We are also planning to purchase musical instruments that children involved in the after school youth programs we work with, can play with, and learn to use.

The Impact

By contributing a few dollars, the cost of a cup of coffee, you ensure a child’s education. You provide another engaging outlet for him or her, and help keep them out of the street. No good deed should go unrecognized, and therefore through your generosity, you are investing in a child’s future to pay it forward to the same community, that did so for them.  

Risks & Challenges

As there is always a risk of not raising enough money to support a cause, many nonprofits fade and are forgotten. In the end, it comes down to the one who created the organization, how passionate he or she is about their cause, and to what end they’ll go to seeing it succeed.

As a former educator and musician, my passion has always been teaching, and performing music; giving back to those that truly need help. Music, no matter the genre, has always been uplifting to the listener, and is the one art that can bring any different culture, gender, or socioeconomic background together.

While we understand the risks, we also believe that there will always be interest in our cause as we keep our focus on children, education, music, and community. We compensate for this risk, by creating community events and fundraisers. We team with other non-profits by having fundraisers or collaborative meetings that share and give advice. We work with musicians that we’ve promoted and recorded at our studio, and look to them to give voice or instrumental music lessons.

Our organization is our passion, our day to day work that we live, breath and have fun with, and because of that, we will always find a way for it to succeed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Financial donations is not the only way of supporting us. If you like what you’ve heard, please help us spread the word by sharing this page. You can also check out our social media and website (through the links below) to find out more about volunteering for lessons and events. Thank you for your time, and we look forward to having your support!

Http://www.JMMInc.org

https://www.facebook.com/The802Musician

https://www.linkedin.com/pub/creighton-jones/58...

story:
We are GeoSoft, a little work team dedicated to software development.

Most people don't learn sign language because a course is too expensive or boring.
Mucha gente no aprende la lengua de señas porque es muy caro o aburrido.
Our project (Lense) is a free mobile application to learn Sign Language, where you will can learn and play passing levels. You will practice words and letters.
Nuestro proyecto (Lense) consiste en una aplicación móvil gratuita para aprender lengua de señas, donde podrás aprender y jugar pasando niveles.
Lense will have two versions, free and pro.
Lense consta de dos versiones, una gratuita y una versión pro.

We don't need an advanced technology, but we need people who can code and solve really hard algorithms. And we need a hosting.

No necesitamos una tecnología avanzada pero sí necesitamos contratar gente que pueda programar y resolver algoritmos realmente complejos. Además necesitamos un hosting.


The pattern recognition algorithms are really hard, but we will hire expert people about that.
Funds will be on hiring programmers and expert people in pattern recognition algorithms.
Nuestros ingresos serán para contratar programadores y expertos en algoritmos de  reconocimiento de patrones.

If you want to be part of our work team, you can talk with us.

Si quieres ser parte de nuestro equipo de trabajo, puedes hablar con nosotros.

story:
On April 25th, Nepal was struck by a devastating 7.8 magnitude earthquake. It took over 8,000 lives and injured more than 17,000 people. To this day, we are still coming to grips with the full extent of the damage.

#NamasteNepal Challenge

1. Donate to our fundraiser

2. Take a photo of you doing Namaste

3. Challenge 3 or more of your friends to do the same challenge.

Read more on the "Updates" tab.

Why mapping?

In the immediate aftermath of the quake, the people of Nepal, the government and the international community were quick to deploy relief efforts. But they faced a major challenge: they often did not have reliable information on where and what kind of help was needed.

A telling example comes from one of our own volunteers, Aashish Dhakal. Together with eight friends, he collected medical supplies and relief items and travelled to Sankhu, one of the badly hit areas in the Kathmandu valley, in hopes of helping the survivors.

“As soon as we got there we realized that the situation was very different than we had expected. There was already enough medical supplies in Sankhu, and we ended up having to bring the supplies back to Kathmandu.At that moment I realized that to help the survivors it is essential to know what is needed where. And to know that you need reliable information.”

This is where the work we do at Kathmandu Living Labs comes in.

What we do

Our Quakemap.org platform enables people who are in the field to report in real time what and where needs are. That information is then used by response, rescue and relief workers to deploy their support more effectively – whether it is shelter, food, medicine or evacuation.

We are also providing response teams with physical and digital maps updated in real time via our QuakeRelief.info platform. They use our maps for navigation, to identify the location of damaged buildings, and even to find landing sites for helicopters.

The most amazing thing about our maps is that they are created thanks to the power of the crowd. The underlying data we use to create the maps is sourced from thousands of volunteers, both inside and outside of Nepal. Since the day of the earthquake, almost 5,000 volunteers from the OpenStreetMap community have helped us create maps for this crisis. The Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team (HOT) has been coordinating this effort from abroad, and we coordinate from Nepal, directing the volunteers to the areas that are in most need of mapping based on the situation on the ground.

For example, after the second major earthquake on May 12th, we received an urgent call for medical help from Sunkhani, Dolakha. We immediately sent out alerts to all the rescue and relief operators That very same day, the Nepal Army evacuated the four people who were reported to be wounded in Sunkhani, including a child.

Who we are

Kathmandu Living Labs (KLL) is a non-profit organization working on open mapping and civic technology in Nepal. Over the past few years, our team has developed detailed hazard maps of Kathmandu using the OpenStreetMap platform. In the aftermath of the April earthquake our maps have proved to be crucial in supporting the relief effort. As the government of Nepal and the humanitarian and development organizations present on the field are starting to plan the reconstruction process, our maps will be used to identify and prioritize needs.

We are partnering with Udhyami Nepali, which is a 501(c)(3) registered non-profit in the United States, in this campaign. 

How we will use the funding

The scale of the disaster is seriously straining our capacity. KLL has been working out of Biruwa Ventures’ coworking space since its inception. The building suffered structural damage due to the first quake and the conditions worsened after the major aftershock on May 12th. Biruwa has generously supported us for the last two years and helped us scale our operations after the earthquake. However, to continue to support the relief efforts and the reconstruction planning, we need to relocate, get more staff on board and purchase additional equipment.

Our work relies on the power of the crowd – staff and volunteers in Nepal and across the world who come together to create maps that provide a crucially important information in this time of crisis. We believe in the power of the crowd, and that is why we are asking for your help to continue doing our work. All of the funding provided will be used to provide better mapping and bridging the information gap in Nepal’s relief and rebuilding.

Our work has received coverage in both local and international press, including:

·  The New York Times,

·  BBC,

·  Wired,

·  Nepali Times,

·  Setopati,

·  My Republica,

·  Canadian Forces portal

We believe in the power of the crowd, and that is why we are asking for your help to continue doing our work. All of the funding provided will be used to provide better mapping and bridging the information gap in Nepal’s relief and rebuilding.Our work has received coverage in both local and international press, including:·  The New York Times,·  BBC,·  Wired,·  Nepali Times,·  Setopati,·  My Republica,·  Canadian Forces portal

story: Hi, I'm Paul Epstein, Director of the West Virginia Young Writers Contest, and co-director of Central WV Writing Project, affiliated with Marshall University (CWVWP). We hold the contest each year with assistance from the West Virginia Department of Education and celebrate the winners each spring at an event held at University of Charleston called West Virginia Young Writer Day, where we treat hundreds of students and their families to writing workshops with published authors, award them certificates, and give cash awards of from $25 - $100 to 18 winners in grades 1-12 at the state level. Here are pictures from the 2013 event: 2013 Pics. The good news is that we have funds in place to pay for the event! The bad news is that because of bureaucratic rules,  WE NEED TO RAISE PRIVATE MONEY FOR THE CASH AWARDS and Mountain State Press (MSP) has graciously volunteered to help us by collecting donations and distributing the awards. If we are successful in doing this, we won't have to do it again next year, because MSP will be reimbursed from existing funds and be able to hold the funds to write the checks on an annual basis. You can help with a donation of any size. Let's do this for the young writers of West Virginia!

story:
As most of you know, my hubs has been away for work for a few months and he still has a couple more months until he gets back home. This is the longest we've been away from each other and I miss him like crazy! So since we missed spending the holidays together, we've decided to take a nice little vacation when he gets back to relax and enjoy each others company.

Note: I will not tell you what my husband's job is nor will I go into detail about what our vacation plans are. I ask that you respect this and not push the subject (even jokingly).

story:
THE SPIRIT OF TROPEA BLUES

Cocktail Competition between Bartender/Mixologist.

Join us and judge which bartender deserves to win !!

TASTE, DRINK, JUDGE and WIN !!


THE SPIRIT OF TROPEA BLUES e' una Cocktail Competition Live on stage tra i Barman in piazza Vittorio Veneto a Tropea in Calabria all'insegna del Bere Consapevole, della Musica e del sano stare insieme divertendosi.
DON'T DRIVE & DRINK ; DRINK RESPONSIBLY.

Bere Consapevole: Saranno offerti durante la serata dei cocktail a basso contenuto di Alcool e sarà' ripetutamente posto in risalto l'importanza di non eccedere con l'Alcool e di non mettersi alla guida quando si e' bevuto un po troppo.

Musica: come intrattenimento e sottofondo alla competizione la DJ Nikki Beatnik  che ha suonato anche per I Rolling Stones ed adesso e' in tournée con Kelis
DJ Nikki suonera' insieme ad una cantante MARIE D considerata al momento in Inghilterra come uno tra i piu' interessanti talenti.

Il tutto sara' magistralmente condotto da Jimmy Barba un bravissimo Ballerino/Attore inglese con origini del Sud Italia che nel 2011 ha partecipato alla trasmissione in Italia del Grande Fratello.
